0.title: Partnerships required for chasing such target: Southee after loss to India
0.article_body: New Zealand seamer Tim Southee commented on the 65-run-loss against India. "Just not able to get going. When you are chasing such a target you need partnerships at some stage," Southee said. India had set a target of 192 runs in the second T20I at Mount Maunganui on Sunday. Notably, Southee clinched a hat-trick in the match.

1.title: Suryakumar's innings was miles apart from other batters: Southee
1.article_body: New Zealand bowler Tim Southee commented on Indian batter Suryakumar Yadav's match-winning century in the second T20I on Sunday. "His (Suryakumar) innings was miles apart from what we saw today from others. His innings took the score to more than what we were hoping for today. Exceptional innings," Southee said. Notably, Yadav scored an unbeaten 111 off 51 balls.

2.title: Hopefully Test cap will come soon: Suryakumar after his 2nd T20I ton
2.article_body: After his unbeaten 111(51) helped India beat New Zealand by 65 runs in second T20I, India batter Suryakumar Yadav, who hasn't made his Test debut so far, said he's hoping that the Test cap will come soon. It was Suryakumar's second T20I ton. Suryakumar added that he has a fair idea about Test cricket, having played 77 first-class matches.

3.title: Heartiest congratulations: Anurag Thakur to Manika on her Asian Cup bronze
3.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur congratulated Manika Batra after the paddler became the first-ever Indian woman to win a medal at Asian Cup. "Heartiest congratulations Manika for creating history," he wrote on Twitter. World number 44 Manika defeated world number six Hina Hayata of Japan 4-2 to win a bronze medal at Asian Cup in Bangkok on Saturday.

4.title: Canadian spy agency investigating death threats from Iran
4.article_body: The Canadian Security Intelligence Service (CSIS) is probing several death threats from Iran to people living in Canada on the basis of "credible intelligence", the agency said in a statement. The threats are "designed to silence those who speak out publicly" against Iran, it added. CSIS said it was working closely with Iranian-Canadian communities which had been targeted  "disproportionately".

5.title: Company to blame for broken ribs, sliced ear, crushed hand: Rivian's US employees
5.article_body: American electric vehicle maker Rivian has been accused of safety violations at its Illinois plant by a dozen employees. They allege that the company ignored known hazards and deprioritised safety resources, resulting in a crushed hand, a broken foot, a sliced ear and broken ribs. The employees also allege they were forced to share respirators required during the manufacturing process.

6.title: 55-yr-old man killed, body chopped into pieces allegedly by son in West Bengal
6.article_body: A 55-year-old man was killed and his body was allegedly cut into pieces and dumped in various places by his son in West Bengal. The wife and college-going son of the man, who retired from the Navy 12 years ago, were arrested in connection with the crime on Saturday. The mother-son duo claimed to be "continuously tortured" by the man.

7.title: I'll be stupid to even think of a special shot in Suryakumar's 111*: Shastri
7.article_body: On being asked to choose a special shot in Suryakumar Yadav's unbeaten 111 off 51 balls against New Zealand in second T20I, Ravi Shastri said, "I'll be stupid to even try and think of a special shot because they were all special." "Last 64 runs came in just 18 deliveries, which is mind-boggling," he stated. India won by 65 runs.

8.title: In pics: 2022 FIFA World Cup opening ceremony in Qatar
8.article_body: The 2022 FIFA World Cup kicked off in Qatar on Sunday. The opening ceremony of the tournament featured a performance by American actor Morgan Freeman. It also featured a performance of a new tournament song called Dreamers featuring singer Jungkook of K-pop boy band BTS. Qatar is hosting and participating in a FIFA World Cup for the first time.

9.title: Video shows women in Rajasthan beating panchayat member for misbehaving
9.article_body: A video showing women beating a panchayat member with sticks in Rajasthan's Bharatpur for misbehaving with them has surfaced. Panchayat members had arrived at the scene to solve a land dispute and allegedly display their authority. The Panchayat Samiti member, Rohtash Meena, was beaten by women while other villagers tried to stop them. The women also tore Meena's clothes.

10.title: Woman killed, 2 injured as elephant demolishes house in Tamil Nadu
10.article_body: A 58-year-old woman was killed and two others were injured after an elephant demolished their house in Tamil Nadu's Gudalur, forest officials said on Sunday. The incident took place around midnight on Saturday when the animal strayed into the human habitat while looking for food. Officials added that they are trying to drive the elephant back into the forest.

11.title: Centre appoints 10 new Executive Directors for public sector banks
11.article_body: The Appointments Committee of the Cabinet has approved the appointment of ten Executive Directors (ED) in various Public Sector Banks. Lalit Tyagi, Chief General Manager of Bank of Baroda, has been appointed as ED of the same bank for three years. Punjab National Bank's Binod Kumar has been named the ED for the same bank for three years as well.

12.title: Air India allows crew to extend tenure under voluntary retirement
12.article_body: Tata Group-owned Air India has given its employees, including the cabin crew who opted for the voluntary retirement scheme (VRS), the option to extend their tenure until January 31, 2023 amid reports of shortage of staff. The release date for those who had opted for the VRS was November 30, 2022. Reportedly, 4,500 staff had applied for the scheme.

13.title: JP Nadda holds roadshow in Delhi, says 'people are tired of AAP govt'
13.article_body: Ahead of the MCD elections in Delhi, BJP's National President JP Nadda on Sunday held a roadshow in the national capital. "The people of Delhi are tired of the Arvind Kejriwal-led AAP government. It's a government which is drowned in corruption," Nadda said during the roadshow. "The number of people gathered here indicates that BJP will be blessed," he added.

14.title: 'Modi-Modi' chants raised during Kejriwal's roadshow in Gujarat
14.article_body: A group of people raised 'Modi-Modi' slogans during Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's roadshow in Gujarat's Panchmahals on Sunday ahead of the Assembly elections. Kejriwal said, "I would like to tell them that you may shout slogans in support of whoever you want, but it's Kejriwal who will make schools for your children." He added that AAP will win their hearts.

15.title: Twitter Head of US Content Partnerships quits, says 'damn we had it good'
15.article_body: Twitter's Head of US Content Partnerships Sarah Rosen is the latest executive to announce her exit from the company after Elon Musk took over. "Took me a few days to come to terms with saying goodbye to 8.5 years at Twitter," said Rosen. She added, "Hot damn we had it good at Twitter 1.0."

16.title: It's an emotion, a blessing: Rishab on Daiva Kola scream from Kantara
16.article_body: Speaking about the scream of Daiva Kola from 'Kantara', actor Rishab Shetty said it's a real thing that happens in their kola. "It's not just a scream...It's a verdict, it's an emotion so it's a blessing," he added. Rishab stated, "I witnessed...that power of nature enters inside a human body...what happens after that is the reaction I tried to recreate."

17.title: 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli attends Governors Awards in Los Angeles
17.article_body: 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli attended the Governors Awards in Los Angeles, a precursor event to the Oscars where celebrities receive honorary statuettes. The film, which grossed over ₹1000 crore globally, featured Jr NTR and Ram Charan among others in pivotal roles. 'RRR'  also won the Best International Film award at the Saturn Awards 2022.

18.title: India doesn't need Aftab, but a leader like PM Modi: Assam CM
18.article_body: Reacting to the murder of Shraddha Walkar by her live-in partner Aftab Poonawala in Delhi, Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said, "Our country doesn't need Aftab, but a person like Lord Ram [and]...leader like PM Narendra Modi." "We need Uniform Civil Code and law against love jihad. We need such laws where Aftabs can be hanged to death," he added.

19.title: Macron accuses Russia of spreading anti-French propaganda in Africa
19.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron on Sunday accused Russia of spreading anti-French propaganda in Africa to serve "predatory" ambitions in troubled African nations. The "perception" that France exploits its former colonies in Africa to serve its own interests was "fed by others" as part of a "political project", Macron told TV5 Monde. "Many influencers...are paid by the Russians," he added.

20.title: Met an Australian minister, he said he really liked 'RRR': Anurag Thakur
20.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur revealed that he recently met an Australian minister, who praised SS Rajamouli's film 'RRR' and said that he really liked the film. "It feels so good to see how the film is now hailed as an international film. RRR not only did the business but also showed the real abilities of Indian cinema," Thakur further added.

21.title: Verstappen wins season-closing Abu Dhabi GP, Vettel finishes 10th in career's last F1 race
21.article_body: Red Bull driver Max Verstappen won the Formula One 2022 season-closing Abu Dhabi Grand Prix. Ferrari driver Charles Leclerc finished second, while Red Bull driver Sergio Perez finished third. Meanwhile, Aston Martin driver and four-time world champion Sebastian Vettel finished 10th in his career's last race. Verstappen won the 2022 season with 454 points.

22.title: Shivaji an idol, hero till sun & moon exist: Fadnavis amid controversy
22.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Sunday said Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj will remain a hero and idol as long as the sun and moon exist. "I feel there is no other role model than that of Shivaji Maharaj in the country," he added. His comments come after Governor BS Koshyari said Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj is an idol of "olden times".

23.title: Mangaluru blast suspect identified, was previously booked under UAPA
23.article_body: The prime suspect in the Mangaluru auto-rickshaw blast case has been identified as Mohammed Shariq from Karnataka's Shivamogga, police said. Shariq had previously been booked under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) for painting a pro-terrorism graffiti on a wall in Mangaluru and was out on bail. He was also absconding in a terror case and was wanted by police.

24.title: Indian fugitive Zakir Naik to preach Islamic sermons at 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar
24.article_body: Islamic preacher Zakir Naik, who's wanted in India over allegations of terror-related activities and inciting hate speeches, has arrived in Qatar for 2022 FIFA World Cup. He'll preach Islamic sermons throughout the tournament, Faisal Alhajri, a presenter at Qatari state-owned sports channel Alkass tweeted. Several videos on social media showed Naik walking into a venue, flanked by volunteers.

25.title: Parts of skull, jaw found by team searching for Shraddha's remains in Delhi forest
25.article_body: Parts of a skull, jaw and other bones were found by a team looking for remains of Shraddha Walkar in Delhi's Mehrauli forest on Sunday, multiple reports said citing police sources. The same will be sent for forensic examination, reports added. Walkar's live-in partner Aftab has reportedly confessed to killing her and concealing the evidence.

26.title: 6th shooter in Dera follower murder case held after encounter in Raj
26.article_body: A suspected shooter involved in the murder of a Dera Sacha Sauda follower was arrested following a brief encounter in a joint operation by Punjab and Rajasthan police in Jaipur on Sunday, officials said. According to police, the main shooter, identified as Ramjan Khan alias Raj Hooda, was injured in his leg in the shoot-out.

27.title: Aditya Chopra took chance on me, said 'I found my next SRK': Ranveer Singh
27.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, who won the 'Superstar of the Decade' award at the Filmfare Middle East Awards, dedicated his award to producer Aditya Chopra. "He took a chance on me when no one did and said 'I found my next Shah Rukh Khan'," he stated. Ranveer made his debut in 'Band Baaja Baraat', which was produced by Yash Raj Films.

28.title: Kareena wraps up shooting for Hansal Mehta's next, shares post
28.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan has completed shooting for an upcoming film, which is being directed by Hansal Mehta. She took to Instagram to share some pictures from the set and wrote, "As they say it's the journey never the destination...make it worthwhile." In a picture, Kareena could be seen posing with a clapboard with "Best Team Ever" written on it.

29.title: Village head cuts birthday cake with illegal pistol in MP; booked
29.article_body: A village sarpanch has been booked in Madhya Pradesh's Bhind for allegedly cutting a cake with a country-made pistol during a birthday celebration in Madhya Pradesh's Bhind district. He allegedly live-streamed the celebrations on Facebook. Police have also registered a case against two other accused.

30.title: There is no prospect of recession in India: Ex-NITI Aayog VC
30.article_body: NITI Aayog's ex-Vice Chairman Rajiv Kumar has said there's a synchronised downturn in US, Europe, Japan and China and that could take the global economy into a recession. He, however, added, "[There's] no such prospect of recession in India because although our growth may be negatively affected by the global conditions, we'll still manage to grow at 6-7% in 2023-24."

31.title: Experts warn of eruption as Russian volcano shows increased activity
31.article_body: The Shiveluch volcano on Russia's Kamchatka Peninsula has become extremely active and a powerful eruption can happen at any time, the Kamchatka Volcanic Eruption Response Team said on Sunday. "A growth of the lava dome continues..., explosions, and hot avalanches accompanies (sic) this process," the observatory added. "Ash explosions up to 10-15kms...could occur at any time," it warned.

32.title: Deadpool Christmas film got lost as Disney acquired Fox: Ryan Reynolds
32.article_body: Actor Ryan Reynolds revealed that he along with 'Deadpool' co-writers Rhett Reese and Paul Wernick wrote a Christmas movie featuring Deadpool four years ago. "But it got lost in the shuffle of Disney acquiring Fox and it never got made," he added. Ryan recently announced the third instalment of the 'Deadpool' franchise with Hugh Jackman.

33.title: 12 hurt, 50 houses gutted as fire breaks out in slum in West Bengal
33.article_body: At least 12 people sustained injuries and around 50 houses were gutted after a fire broke out in a slum in West Bengal's Siliguri, officials said on Sunday. Three of the injured persons, including a firefighter and a child, are undergoing treatment in a hospital, officials added. Eight fire tenders were pressed into service to douse the flames.

34.title: Williamson's future looks slightly uncertain in NZ's T20I team: Aakash
34.article_body: Aakash Chopra stated that Kane Williamson's future looks slightly uncertain in New Zealand's T20I team, although the captain has said that he'll play all three formats. "This country might not have that much batting depth...but T20 cricket is continuously asking him tough questions. Once in a while he plays a good knock but doesn't really change the world," he added.

35.title: Pakistani actor Fahad Mustafa touches Govinda's feet at an event in Dubai, video viral
35.article_body: During Filmfare Middle East Achievers Night 2022 in Dubai, Pakistani actor Fahad Mustafa touched Govinda's feet. A video of the same has gone viral. Before his gesture, Mustafa said on stage, "I started acting in the first place because of Govinda sir." He added, "I hope Pakistan and India once again come together to do good work."

36.title: You're supposed to show strength but we're not machines: Federer
36.article_body: Former world number one tennis player, Roger Federer, spoke on the issue of the mental health of contemporary athletes. "You're supposed to show strength. But we're not machines, we're human beings," Federer said. "The tour is tough...the travel, the practice, the jetlag. Nobody is allowed to say, 'I'm tired today,' because it looks like you're weak," he added.

37.title: Who's 'merchant of death' Viktor Bout whom Russia wants in exchange for US' Griner?
37.article_body: Russia is hoping to swap arms trafficker Viktor Bout, known as the 'merchant of death', in exchange for American WNBA player Brittney Griner. The Russian, who's serving a 25-year prison sentence in the US, had the capacity to 'transport weapons virtually anywhere in the world'. He was arrested after being lured into a trap in Thailand by US DEA agents.

38.title: Which are the top 10 ranked football teams ahead of 2022 FIFA World Cup?
38.article_body: As per the latest FIFA rankings ahead of 2022 FIFA World Cup, Brazil are the top-ranked team, followed by Belgium, Argentina, France and England. Italy, who failed to qualify for the Qatar World Cup, are ranked sixth. Spain are ranked seventh, followed by Netherlands, Portugal and Denmark.

39.title: Parading employees naked makes it easy for them to pee on you: Anupam to Musk
39.article_body: Shaadi.com Founder and Shark Tank India judge Anupam Mittal tweeted, "As smart as he is, why does Elon Musk fail to understand that if you parade subordinates naked in townhall, it makes it easy for them to pee on you in public." He added, "Respect is a two-way street, isn't it?" Musk sacked Twitter's 50% workforce after taking it over.

40.title: Students fire several rounds at Patna University after student body polls
40.article_body: A group of students fired several rounds at Patna University on Saturday after the student union elections. Police were deployed at the university to maintain law and order in the area. The Janata Dal (United) swept the Patna University Students' Union (PUSU) election by winning four out of five seats.

41.title: EPFO adds 16.82 lakh members in Sept, posts 9% YoY rise
41.article_body: Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) added 16.82 lakh members in September 2022, marking an increase of 9.14% as compared to the year-ago period, Labour Ministry data showed. Of the total additions, around 9.34 lakh members have come under the coverage of EPFO for the first time. About 58.75% of the new members are from the age group of 18-25 years.

42.title: Govt mulling to remove penal offences covered under IPC from GST law: Report
42.article_body: The government is considering to remove the penal offences which are already covered under the Indian Penal Code from the GST Act to make it more taxpayer-friendly, report said. The amendments would be placed before the GST Council for approval, before going to Parliament for effecting changes. Once approved, states would be required to amend their state GST laws.

43.title: It's a gateway for the world to know the real me: Bhavana on 'Fabulous...'
43.article_body: 'Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives' star Bhavana Pandey spoke about how her life has changed after the show. "Earlier, I was...celebrated as a wife and mother...but today people know me as Bhavana and have wonderful things to say," she said, adding, "Fabulous Lives of Bollywood Wives isn't just a show but a gateway for...world to know the real me."

44.title: Had my gameplan, it worked well: Suryakumar on his 111* in 2nd T20I
44.article_body: After India won their second T20I by 65 runs against New Zealand, India batter Suryakumar Yadav, who was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for his 51-ball 111*, said he had a clear plan when he went to bat. "I feel that I didn't think too much about what was happening. Just had my gameplan and it worked well," he added.

45.title: 'Depressed' man dies by suicide in Mumbai after friend's death
45.article_body: A 42-year-old man died by hanging himself from the ceiling fan at his residence in Mulund, Mumbai on Saturday. The deceased, Mayur Thakkar-Khant, was in depression over the death of his close friend, Nilesh Mali, who died 12 days ago, police said. The incident happened when Mayur's wife and their son were not present at the residence, police added.

46.title: Moody's to shut its consulting business in China, lay off staff: Report
46.article_body: Global credit rating agency Moody's Corporation is shutting down its consulting business in China and laying off staff across multiple locations across the country, Reuters reported. The layoffs will reportedly affect over 100 employees in Beijing, Shanghai and Shenzhen offices. Recently, Moody's said it was taking measures to align its global workforce with the current economic conditions.

47.title: 2 die, 7 hospitalised as workers in Shimla burn coal in room amid cold
47.article_body: Two labourers died and seven others were hospitalised after they burnt coal inside a room to cope with the cold in Himachal Pradesh's Shimla, police said on Sunday. As per reports, the gas formation combined with the lack of air inside the room led to suffocation. Local villagers, who opened the door later, found all the labourers unconscious.

48.title: A top critic was after my blood, he used to call me 'wooden': Suniel Shetty
48.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty in a recent interview opened up about how a "top critic" used to criticise him. "[He] was after my blood. He used to ridicule me very often, [call] me wooden and insist that I should go back to...restaurant business," he said. "It hurt...But one day...I realised...this guy must be having a personal grudge against me," Suniel added.

49.title: Licious not planning IPO before 2025-26: Co-founder Vivek Gupta
49.article_body: Online meat delivery unicorn Licious' Co-founder Vivek Gupta said that the company is not planning an initial public offering (IPO) before 2025-26 despite expecting its revenue to cross the ₹1,500 crore mark in 12 months. "We need to be EBITDA profitable and I will not take this company public before we start generating cash profit," Gupta added.

50.title: 1 dead, 4 injured after students crash car into bus near Hyderabad
50.article_body: One person died and four others were injured after six engineering students crashed their car into a stationary bus on National Highway- 65 at Isnapur near Hyderabad. The students were reportedly returning to Hyderabad from a road trip to Goa. A report claimed there were three rash driving challans pending against the speeding car in Siddipet and Warangal districts.

51.title: 1.9 kg of heroin hidden inside carton box seized at B'luru airport; 1 held
51.article_body: Customs officials on Friday arrested a man at Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport for allegedly carrying 1.9 kg of heroin concealed inside the layers of a carton box that he carried as check-in baggage. The man was produced before a magistrate and remanded to judicial custody. He was travelling from Ethiopia's Addis Ababa to Bengaluru.

52.title: Former Congress MP Mahabal Mishra joins AAP ahead of MCD polls
52.article_body: Former MP and Congress leader Mahabal Mishra on Sunday joined AAP ahead of the Delhi Municipal Corporation election. He joined the AAP in the presence of AAP National Convenor and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal during his public rally in Paharganj. Mahabal Mishra's son Vinay Mishra is an Aam Aadmi Party MLA from Dwarka.

53.title: Ranveer breaks down while recalling his struggle during award show in Dubai, video viral
53.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh broke down while recalling his struggle during Filmfare Middle East Achievers Night 2022 award show in Dubai. In a video that went viral, Ranveer, after receiving an award, can be heard saying, "The portfolio would cost ₹50,000, which I thought was a lot, but my father asked me not to worry and said he will help me."

54.title: Security forces detect 120 IEDs planted by Maoists in Jharkhand
54.article_body: Security forces engaged in anti-Naxal operation detected 120 improvised explosive devices (IED) planted by Maoists in Jharkhand's Latehar district, police said. The IEDs have been defused, police added. Security forces on Thursday detected and seized a 15-kg cooker bomb, a claymore mine, three detonators, a Motorola wireless set, two ammunition pouches and Naxal literature in Latehar and Garhwa.

55.title: ₹16,328-cr Phase 3 project of B'luru metro gets state govt's approval
55.article_body: Karnataka government on Friday approved the ₹16,328-crore Phase 3 project of Bengaluru's Namma Metro. "By 2041, Bengaluru will have 314 km of metro rail," Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation MD Anjum Parwez said. Phase 3 will have two corridors-one along Outer Ring Road, with 22 stations covering 32.15 km, and the other via Magadi Road, with nine stations covering 12.5 km.

56.title: Fireball flashes across the night sky in Canada; video surfaces
56.article_body: A fireball was seen flying across the night sky in Ontario, Canada, on November 19. Sharing a video of the event, the European Space Agency (ESA) said that the approximately 1-metre space object struck Earth over Canada, creating a "stunning fireball". The meteor was the only sixth object detected in space before striking Earth, the ESA added.

57.title: Shaheen Afridi undergoes appendectomy, shares pic from hospital
57.article_body: Pakistan fast bowler Shaheen Afridi took to Twitter to reveal that he underwent appendectomy on Sunday. Sharing a picture from hospital, Shaheen wrote, "Had an appendectomy today but Alhumdulillah feeling better. Remember me in your prayers." Earlier, Shaheen had suffered a knee injury during the final of T20 World Cup 2022.

58.title: Can't get any better than this: Hardik on India's 65-run win in 2nd T20I
58.article_body: Following India's 65-run win against New Zealand in second T20I, India captain Hardik Pandya said, "Can't get any better than this." He added, "Everyone chipped it but it was surely a special innings by Suryakumar Yadav...Bowlers did well and everyone had an aggressive mindset." Chasing 192, New Zealand were bowled out for 126 in 18.5 overs.

59.title: Cristiano Ronaldo is in spectacular form: Portugal WC squad member
59.article_body: Portugal team's footballer Ruben Neves said that his colleague Cristiano Ronaldo is in spectacular form ahead of the FIFA World Cup in Qatar. "He (Ronaldo) doesn't worry us at all, we as a team know perfectly well what we need to work on...If we're good as a team, Cristiano will be phenomenal," 25-year-old Neves said.

60.title: Tabu single-handledly saving Bollywood: Kangana Ranaut on 'Drishyam 2'
60.article_body: On Instagram Stories, Kangana Ranaut wrote  'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' and 'Drishyam 2' have been the only two Bollywood films that have been successful this year and both these films featured Tabu. "[Tabu is] single-handledly saving the Hindi film industry...Her talent...consistency have never been questioned, but to...reach the peak of her stardom in her 50s is commendable," she added.

61.title: Father held for rape of Pune girl; search on for grandfather, uncle
61.article_body: Pune Police have arrested the father of a 17-year-old girl, who was allegedly raped and sexually abused by him, her grandfather and uncle multiple times over the past six years. Further, police have sent a team to UP to arrest her grandfather and uncle. She made the revelation before a committee on sexual harassment at her college in the city.

62.title: 10 men, 9 women lashed 39 times for adultery & theft in Afghanistan
62.article_body: A Supreme Court official Abdul Rahim Rashid said on Sunday that 19 people, including 10 men and nine women, were lashed for adultery, theft and running away from home in northeastern Afghanistan on November 11. On Thursday, a Taliban spokesperson said they are committed to implementing all Sharia laws. Rahim said the 19 people were lashed 39 times each.

63.title: Truck crashes during Christmas parade in US, kills girl
63.article_body: A girl was killed after being hit by a truck that crashed while pulling a float at a Christmas parade in the US city of Raleigh, North Carolina on Saturday. The driver who lost control of the vehicle has been charged with reckless driving and other offences, the police said. The victim was also reportedly a part of the event.

64.title: Test cricket always first, far above ODIs and T20Is: Starc
64.article_body: Australia pacer Mitchell Starc said that for him, Test cricket is always first priority. "Tests...far above white-ball [cricket]...I would love to...continue playing Test cricket as long as I can," Starc said. He added, "It's certainly impossible...to play every game as a three-format player. We've seen that...sometimes there are two Australian teams playing at the same time."

65.title: Working on slower ones, yorkers for T20 cricket: Umran Malik
65.article_body: Team India pacer Umran Malik said that he is working on developing new deliveries for T20 cricket. "I am working on slowers and yorkers for T20s. Also, I am working very well on pitching good-length and hard-length balls,'' Malik said. The 22-year-old added, "I have to bowl fast, but I will also bowl with the variations."

66.title: This loss is so personal: Suniel Shetty pens note after Tabassum's death
66.article_body: Actor Suniel Shetty took to social media to pen a note on veteran actress Tabassum following her demise. "This loss is so personal," he wrote with a broken heart emoji. "My love for acting & cinema stemmed from her Phool Khile Hain Gulshan Gulshan. Rest in Peace Tabassum Ji. You will be missed so much," Suniel added.

67.title: Teachers condemn Jamia dissolving JTA, suspension of professor
67.article_body: Jamia Millia Islamia teachers have condemned the university for dissolving the Jamia Teachers' Association (JTA) and suspending Professor Sonya Surabhi Gupta after she notified to conduct the teachers' association election without permission. The now-dissolved JTA called a meeting to discuss the issue, however, the administration alleged that it would disrupt the university's smooth functioning.

68.title: Govt to issue framework against fake reviews on e-commerce sites next week
68.article_body: Consumer Affairs Secretary Rohit Kumar Singh said the government will release frameworks to counter fake reviews and unverified star ratings on e-commerce websites and hotel and travel booking platforms next week. He mentioned that the Bureau of Indian Standards has also come out with a standard. "Initially, it will be voluntary and gradually will be made mandatory," he added.

69.title: Chiranjeevi & Anil dance at 1980s reunion party, Anupam shares video
69.article_body: Anupam Kher has shared a video from a reunion bash, which was hosted by Jackie Shroff and Poonam Dhillon last week in Mumbai. A part of the video showed actors Anil Kapoor and Chiranjeevi dancing at the party. Several 1980s actors from the Indian film industry, including Meenakshi Seshadri, Sarathkumar, Khushboo and Ramya Krishnan, attended the reunion.

70.title: 77-yr-old Mumbai woman loses ₹3.14 cr in share trading; 1 arrested
70.article_body: A 77-year-old woman was allegedly cheated of ₹3.14 crore by a share trading agent in Mumbai. The victim, Celino Pinto, lost her money after the accused, Naresh Bharat Singh, diverted her funds to a fake Demat account, police said. Pinto is a resident of Shimpoli in Borivali West while Naresh is from Delhi and has been arrested by the police.

71.title: Deepak Hooda records best-ever T20I bowling figures by an Indian in New Zealand
71.article_body: Team India all-rounder Deepak Hooda on Sunday recorded the best-ever bowling figures by an Indian in T20I cricket on New Zealand soil. The 27-year-old registered figures of 2.5-0-10-4 in the second T20I against New Zealand in Mount Maunganui to set the record. The previous record was set by Jasprit Bumrah (4.0-1-12-3) in 2020.

72.title: Akhilesh Yadav touches his uncle Shivpal's feet at poll rally in Mainpuri
72.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Sunday touched his uncle Shivpal Yadav's feet while campaigning for the Lok Sabha by-poll in UP's Mainpuri. In a video, he can be seen greeting his uncle, touching his feet and then greeting the crowd. Notably, Akhilesh Yadav's wife Dimple Yadav will contest from Mainpuri seat, which fell vacant following Mulayam Singh Yadav's demise.

73.title: Police looking for Shraddha's head pump out water from a pond in Delhi
73.article_body: Police and municipal workers on Sunday pumped out water from a pond in Delhi's Mehrauli area in search of the head of Shraddha Walker, who was murdered and cut into 35 pieces by her live-in partner Aftab Poonawalla. Aftab reportedly told the investigating team that he dumped Shraddha's dismembered head in a pond. Aftab's five-day police custody ends on Tuesday.

74.title: Jyotika joins Rajkummar Rao's 'SRI', her first Hindi film in 21 yrs
74.article_body: Tamil actress Jyotika has signed her first Hindi film in 21 years. She will feature in Rajkummar Rao-starrer 'SRI', which is a biopic on industrialist Srikanth Bolla. Earlier, Jyotika featured in 'Doli Saja Ke Rakhna' (1998) and the trilingual film 'Little John' (2001). 'SRI', which will also star Alaya F in a pivotal role, will be helmed by Tushar Hiranandani.

75.title: US bishop accused of sexual abuse asks to be removed from priesthood
75.article_body: Howard Hubbard, a retired US bishop who has admitted to shielding priests facing sexual misconduct allegations and has himself been accused of sexual abuse, has asked Pope Francis to remove him from the priesthood. Hubbard said he wanted to be laicized because he could no longer function as a priest, given US church policy that bars accused priests from ministry.

76.title: Was waiting for something that wasn’t trying to be 'Golmaal': Tusshar
76.article_body: Tusshar Kapoor said that he was "waiting for something that's not trying to be another 'Golmaal'" and wanted to do something, which was "against" his on-screen image. Speaking about his upcoming project 'Maarrich', Tusshar said he has moved out of his comfort zone with this film. "It's been a while since I played a character that is grey," he added.

77.title: Future of social media doesn't have to belong to a billionaire: Mastodon
77.article_body: Twitter's rival platform Mastodon in a tweet said, "The future of social media doesn't have to belong to a billionaire, it can be in the hands of its users." Mastodon, which is increasingly being used by people after Twitter's acquisition by Elon Musk, just passed over 2 million active monthly users, setting a new record for the company.

78.title: 5 killed, 18 injured in shooting at gay nightclub in US
78.article_body: Five people were killed and 18 injured in shooting at a gay nightclub on Saturday night in US' Colorado Springs. A suspect was in custody and was being treated for injuries after the attack at Club Q. In a statement, Club Q said it was "devastated by senseless attack on our community" and offered condolences to victims and their families.

79.title: Malaysia gets hung Parliament for 1st time in history
79.article_body: Malaysia's general elections ended in a hung Parliament with the alliance led by long-time Opposition leader Anwar Ibrahim getting the maximum number of seats. His alliance was followed by the one led by former PM Muhyiddin Yassin. Reportedly, Malaysia's constitutional monarch may choose the PM. Notably, veteran leader Mahathir Mohamad lost an election for the first time in 53 years.

80.title: Turkish air raids hit Kurdish-held areas in northern Syria
80.article_body: Turkish air strikes hit several towns across northern Syria late Saturday, US-backed Kurdish-led forces said. Turkey targeted areas controlled by the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF), the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights reported. Syrian army troops and SDF fighters were reportedly among those killed. Ankara said it targeted bases from where militants staged attacks on Turkey.

81.title: Foreign investors buy Indian equities worth ₹30,385 cr in Nov so far
81.article_body: Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPI) have invested a net sum of ₹30,385 crore in equities during November 1-18, according to data with the depositories. The total outflow by FPIs in equities in 2022 stands at ₹1.4 lakh crore. On the other hand, foreign investors have pulled out ₹422 crore from the debt market during the period under review.

82.title: Cong has no moral grounds after aligning with Narmada activist: PM Modi
82.article_body: PM Narendra Modi criticised the Bharat Jodo Yatra for including activist Medha Patkar, who "stalled" the Narmada dam project "for three decades". "The Narmada project was the only solution to quench the thirst of the arid region of Kutch and Kathiyawad," he said. PM Modi urged Gujarat citizens to ask Congress on what "moral grounds" they are "seeking votes".

83.title: 64-yr-old railway doctor out for cycling dies as 4-wheeler crushes him in UP
83.article_body: A 64-year-old doctor at North Eastern Railway (NER) hospital was killed after a speeding four-wheeler crushed him near the 1090 crossing when he was out cycling. Police said that the deceased was a fitness enthusiast. The driver of the four-wheeler ran away from the scene. Some commuters informed the police about him.

84.title: 4 coal thieves killed, 2 injured in gunfight with CISF personnel in J’khand
84.article_body: At least four coal thieves were killed while two got injured during a gunfight with CISF personnel in Jharkhand’s Dhanbad, police said on Sunday. "The on-duty CISF personnel tried to stop coal thieves, who gathered in large numbers. However, when they attacked the jawans, a gunfight erupted in retaliation," Dhanbad SP (Rural), Reeshma Ramesan, said.

85.title: Mangaluru auto blast accused's Mysuru home raided, bomb squad deployed in area
85.article_body: The rented Mysuru home of the main accused in the Mangaluru autorickshaw blast incident was raided on Sunday, police said. According to reports, a bomb squad has been deployed for a combing operation in the area. DGP Praveen Sood said that the accused was carrying explosives and also had a fake or stolen Aadhaar card.

86.title: Tree branch falls on car during Formula E trials in Hyderabad; video surfaces
86.article_body: An accident was averted on Saturday after branch of a tree fell on one of the cars during the trial runs for Formula E race in Hyderabad. The incident occurred near Hyderabad's Prasads IMAX. The video of the incident went viral in which the branch can be seen falling on the racing car that lost control for a few seconds.

87.title: Bharat Jodo's positive energy undone by criticising Savarkar: Raut
87.article_body: Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray) leader Sanjay Raut said that the positive energy generated due to the Congress's Bharat Jodo Yatra has been undone by Rahul Gandhi's criticism of VD Savarkar. Raut questioned why Gandhi was giving the BJP a chance to divert attention from the yatra. He also questioned why Savarkar has not gotten the Bharat Ratna yet.

88.title: Nepal’s missing rare white-rumped vulture found in Bihar
88.article_body: A missing white-rumped vulture, being used by Nepal to monitor the population of the rare endangered species and the success of a breeding drive, was rescued in Bihar’s Darbhanga earlier this month, officials said. The male vulture with a satellite tag had gone off the radar since April and was last sighted in Nepal's Tanahun district in September.

89.title: Actor Naga Shaurya marries interior designer Anusha Shetty, pics surface
89.article_body: Actor Naga Shaurya got married to interior designer Anusha Shetty in Bengaluru after reportedly dating for around two years. Pictures of the couple from their wedding have surfaced online. Shaurya and Anusha's pre-wedding celebrations had taken place at a Bengaluru hotel on Saturday. A grand reception will reportedly take place in Hyderabad later.

90.title: Guess 'helped themselves to my artwork without asking,' says Banksy; shares post
90.article_body: Graffiti artist Banksy has accused Guess of using his work without permission. Banksy wrote on Instagram, "Attention...shoplifters. Please go to Guess on Regent Street. They've helped themselves to my artwork without asking, how can it be wrong for you to do the same to their clothes?" Guess said its collection was in collaboration with Brandalised, which licenses graffiti artists' designs.

91.title: Parveen Babi resented my stardom in Italy, shares Kabir Bedi
91.article_body: Kabir Bedi said that while he "didn't bother" about actress Parveen Babi's stardom in India, she had "resentment" towards his stardom in Italy. "She wasn't used to being second fiddle to me. Suddenly, I was the star and she wasn't. This also upset her," he shared. Bedi rose to fame (in Italy) with his series 'Sandokan', which aired in 1976.

92.title: Was reluctant to do Aashiqui, saw how Devdas beat woman: Anu Aggarwal
92.article_body: Actress Anu Aggarwal, known for her role in 'Aashiqui', said that she was reluctant to do the 1990 film at first. "I was put off by the way...women were depicted in Hindi movies, way back in the 90s," she stated. "Like we were shown 'Devdas'...I saw how Devdas beats up a woman when she refuses to marry him," she added.

93.title: Make sure BJP wins each & every polling booth in Guj: PM to voters
93.article_body: Addressing a rally in poll-bound Gujarat on Sunday, PM Narendra Modi urged the people to turn up in large numbers at their respective polling booths on the voting day and break all the previous records of voter turnout. "Another thing I want from you is to make sure the BJP wins each and every booth [in Gujarat]," PM Modi added.

94.title: 5 boys attack schoolgirl's father with iron rod in Pune; detained
94.article_body: Police have detained five minor boys for allegedly attacking the father of a girl student at a school with a sharp weapon and an iron rod in Pune's Lohegaon. The incident took place after the man approached and questioned the boys for allegedly passing comments and harassing people near the school. The victim suffered severe injuries in the incident.

95.title: Want to see how much this Ishan-Pant opening pair gets backed by team: Nehra
95.article_body: Former India pacer Ashish Nehra has said he wants to see how much the team management will back the opening pair of Ishan Kishan and Rishabh Pant in T20Is. The duo opened India's batting in the second T20I against New Zealand. "I want to see what [India] do with their opening options, main thing is...they cannot be confused," added Nehra.

96.title: I felt like a zombie: Joe Root on why he quit as England Test captain
96.article_body: England batter Joe Root opened up on his decision to step down as England's Test captain earlier this year, revealing that he almost felt like a "zombie" and wasn't able to enjoy time with his family. "The captaincy was starting to take a toll on me," said Root. "As soon as I [quit]...I [felt] so much better," he further said.

97.title: Night sky has been lit up by Surya: Tendulkar on Suryakumar's 111*(51) vs NZ
97.article_body: Reacting to India batter Suryakumar Yadav's 51-ball 111* against New Zealand in second T20I, Sachin Tendulkar tweeted, "The night sky has been lit up by Surya! What a blinder." Mohammad Shami took to Twitter and wrote, "Congratulations for 111* (51)." It was Suryakumar's second T20I ton. India won the match by 65 runs. Suryakumar was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

98.title: Priyanka silent on Shraddha murder case to keep 'vote banks' safe: UP Dy CM
98.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Keshav Prasad Maurya criticised Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi for her silence on the Shraddha Walkar murder case, saying she is keeping her "vote banks" safe. "Congress' Priyanka Gandhi says 'beti hun lad sakti hun' but has not spoken a word on this incident. Why is she silent?" said Maurya.

99.title: Zepto reports ₹390 crore loss in first year of operations
99.article_body: Quick-commerce startup Zepto has reported a loss of ₹390.4 crore in the first year of its operations on a standalone basis. In FY22, Zepto generated a total revenue of ₹142.4 crore, according to regulatory filings. Founded by Aadit Palicha and Kaivalya Vohra in April 2021, the Mumbai-based soonicorn is currently valued at $900 million.

100.title: BJP should remove Koshyari from Maha Guv's post as he insulted Shivaji: Raut
100.article_body: Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray) leader Sanjay Raut criticised Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari for calling Shivaji Maharaj an 'old idol' and said that BJP should apologise to everyone and remove Koshyari from the post. "The Governor has insulted Shivaji Maharaj four times in one year. Still, the government is silent," said Raut.

101.title: Big B's 'angry young man' inspired my 'Kantara' role: Rishab
101.article_body: Actor Rishab Shetty has said he has been a fan of Amitabh Bachchan and added that he had watched several Bollywood films of the veteran actor. Speaking about his role in his film 'Kantara', Rishab added, "The 'angry young man' Amitabh was, that definitely was in Shiva (Rishab's character in 'Kantara')." Rishab has also directed and written 'Kantara'.

102.title: Mother Dairy hikes token milk price by ₹2/litre in Delhi-NCR
102.article_body: Mother Dairy has hiked the price of its token milk by ₹2 per litre in Delhi-NCR citing a rise in input cost. The price of full-cream milk has been increased by ₹1 per litre. The latest hike in milk prices, the fourth this year by Mother Dairy, will come into effect on Monday, the company said.

103.title: My dear Bibing, stay young & fit always: Salman on Kiren Rijiju's b'day
103.article_body: Salman Khan took to Instagram to wish Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju on his birthday. Sharing a picture with Rijiju, he wrote, "My dear Bibing, wishing you on your b'day abundance of love, health and happiness, stay young and fit always." On the work front, Salman will next be seen in 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan' and 'Tiger 3'.

104.title: Faulty signals under fire as 96 pedestrians die in Pune
104.article_body: In 2022, till October, there have been 96 pedestrian road crash deaths in Pune, according to Save Pune Traffic Movement (SPTM) which cited faulty pedestrian signals in the city as the reason behind these fatalities. Harshad Abhyankar, Director, SPTM, said that the PMC is not registering complaints. Shrinivas Kandul, head, PMC Electrical Department, said they will receive funds next month.

105.title: One of world's largest aircraft lands at Kolkata Airport; pics surface
105.article_body: One of the world’s largest aircraft Airbus Beluga made a landing at Kolkata Airport on Sunday for crew rest and refuelling. The Kolkata Airport authority shared pictures of the aircraft and wrote, "Guess who's back! It's the whale again!" This is the third time the aircraft visited Kolkata, the last being in May this year and before that in 1999.

106.title: COP27 ends in Egypt with decision to establish loss and damage fund
106.article_body: The UN Conference on Climate Change, COP27, concluded in Egypt on Sunday with a decision to establish a loss and damage fund to assist developing countries that are vulnerable to the adverse effects of climate change. "I welcome the decision to establish a loss and damage fund and to operationalise it in the coming period," UN Secretary-General António Guterres said.

107.title: Bankrupt FTX owes nearly $3.1 billion to its 50 biggest creditors
107.article_body: Collapsed cryptocurrency exchange FTX owes its 50 biggest creditors nearly $3.1 billion, revealed court filings. FTX, which filed for US bankruptcy court protection, said that it owes about $1.45 billion to its top ten creditors but didn't name them. On Saturday, FTX said that it is preparing for the sale or reorganisation of some businesses.

108.title: Former anti-abortion activist says key 2014 US SC ruling was leaked
108.article_body: A former anti-abortion activist has claimed he was informed in advance about the outcome of a 2014 US Supreme Court case involving contraceptives, The New York Times reported. Reverend Rob Schenck said he was tipped off about the pending ruling in the Burwell v. Hobby Lobby case shortly after two conservative allies had dinner at SC Justice Samuel Alito's home.

109.title: Had to leave 'Soldier' set for more than a week due to my exams: Preity
109.article_body: Preity Zinta in an Instagram post recalled shooting for her 1998 movie 'Soldier'. She said that she had to leave the set for more than a week while shooting for the climax scene due to her psychology exams. "Thank you Bobby (Deol) for being you & for bringing me into...movies & thank you to...entire...crew for so much fun," Preity added.

110.title: FIFA earns revenue of $7.5 bn for Qatar World Cup period
110.article_body: FIFA said that it has earned a revenue of $7.5 billion in the four years of commercial deals tied to the 2022 World Cup in Qatar. Qatar Energy joined FIFA as a top-tier sponsor, and new third-tier sponsors include Qatari bank QNB and telecoms firm Ooredoo. FIFA also added financial platform Crypto.com and blockchain provider Algorand as second-tier sponsors.

111.title: 4 big cranes, 400 workers deployed for dismantling of Mumbai's Carnac Bridge
111.article_body: Four big cranes and 400 workers have been deployed for the dismantling of Mumbai's Carnac Bridge, reports said. The 27-hour mega block in the city in view of the dismantling began on Saturday night. Central Railway took to Twitter to share a video of the ongoing dismantling process. Meanwhile, reports said that the bridge will be cut into 44 pieces.

112.title: India record their biggest-ever T20I victory on New Zealand soil
112.article_body: India defeated New Zealand by 65 runs in second T20I in Mount Maunganui on Sunday. It's India's biggest-ever victory (by runs) in T20I cricket on New Zealand soil. The match witnessed Suryakumar Yadav smash 111*(51), his second hundred in T20Is. India have taken a 1-0 lead in the three-match series. The first match was abandoned due to rain in Wellington.

113.title: 26-yr-old woman techie raped by man she met on matrimonial site in Pune
113.article_body: A 26-year-old woman, working for a multinational IT company in Pune's Pimpri Chinchwad, was allegedly raped by a man whom she met on a matrimonial website. She alleged that he raped her twice, promising that he would marry her and that they also held a pre-wedding tilak ceremony. The man has been identified as an IT engineer from UP's Prayagraj.

114.title: Faridabad policewoman arrested for receiving bribe to not book man for rape
114.article_body: Faridabad Police female constable was arrested for allegedly receiving a bribe from a man, who was booked for alleged dowry harassment, to not add rape sections to the FIR filed by his wife. The accused constable, Kalpana, had already received ₹20,000 from the man, Shabbir, and was demanding ₹15,000 more. Later, Kalpana was caught red-handed in a police laid-trap.

115.title: India break world record for playing most matches in a calendar year
115.article_body: Team India have broken the world record for playing the most number of matches in a calendar year. The second T20I against New Zealand on Sunday is India's 62nd international match in 2022. India overtook Australia, who had played 61 international matches in 2009. Further, it is India's 39th T20I match this year.

116.title: Didn't watch it but I'm sure it was another video game innings: Kohli on Suryakumar's 111*
116.article_body: Reacting to Suryakumar Yadav slamming 111*(51) against New Zealand in second T20I, Virat Kohli tweeted, "Numero Uno showing why he's the best in the world." He added, "Didn't watch it live...but I'm sure this was another video game innings by him." Suryakumar slammed 11 fours and seven sixes. Suryakumar is first Indian to slam a T20I hundred in New Zealand.

117.title: Rare bird spotted for the first time in 140 years on Fergusson Island; pic released
117.article_body: Scientists have 'rediscovered' the Black-naped Pheasant-Pigeon after spotting it some 140 years after its last sighting. The rare large, ground-dwelling pigeon, was photographed with a remote camera trap at the end of a month-long search of Fergusson Island in Papua New Guinea. Scientists hope the rare bird's rediscovery will provide a basis for its conservation.

118.title: Kajal reunites with Kamal Sadanah after 30 yrs for ‘Salaam Venky’
118.article_body: Bollywood actress Kajol will be seen sharing screen space with Kamal Sadanah after 30 years. Kajol and Kamal will be seen in Revathy's directorial venture 'Salaam Venky', which is set to release on December 9. Kajol and Kamal had earlier featured in the actress' Bollywood debut film 'Bekhudi' (1992). 'Salaam Venky' marks Kajol's first collaboration with Revathy.

119.title: Mahesh Bhatt, Denzongpa didn't object mention of Parveen Babi in my book: Kabir
119.article_body: Actor Kabir Bedi has revealed that filmmaker Mahesh Bhatt and actor Danny Denzongpa did not object to him writing about his and their relationships with late actress Parveen Babi in his autobiography. "What I wrote in the book is true and they (Mahesh and Danny) know it. There is nothing to hide here," he further added.

120.title: Veteran actor Amol Palekar, wife Sandhya join Cong’s Bharat Jodo Yatra
120.article_body: Veteran actor Amol Palekar and his wife writer-filmmaker Sandhya Gokhale joined Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra led by party leader Rahul Gandhi in Maharashtra’s Buldhana district on Sunday. "Realising his responsibility towards the country, today famous actor and film director Amol Palekar along with his wife joined Bharat Jodo Yatra…Thank you for raising the voice of the country," Congress tweeted.

121.title: Deloitte says India likely to post 6.5-7.1% growth in current fiscal
121.article_body: India is expected to post an economic growth of 6.5-7.1% during the current financial year and 5.5-6.1% the following year amid rising inflation and global slowdown, a Deloitte India report said. The report said the upcoming festive season could boost the consumer sector. Credit growth in the industry and services sector has also risen remarkably, the report added.

122.title: Suspects barge into village house near Greater Noida, fire several gunshots
122.article_body: A few people entered a house in Anandpur village near Greater Noida on Friday and allegedly fired three rounds of bullets to threaten the residents. The complainant, Sumit, alleged that the suspects assaulted his brother and elderly parents. The six accused are residents of the same village and have had a dispute with the complainant's family since 2019, police said.

123.title: Uttarakhand CM runs, plays badminton with people in Almora; video surfaces
123.article_body: A video has surfaced in which Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami can be seen running and playing badminton with young sports enthusiasts in Almora this morning. "I ran and played badminton…During this, feedback was also taken from young colleagues and local people about the work being done by the government," said Dhami.

124.title: World no. 4 Ruud beats Rublev to reach maiden final at ATP Finals
124.article_body: World number four Casper Ruud reached the title match of ATP Finals for the first time after a 6-2, 6-4 win over sixth-seeded Andrey Rublev in Turin on Saturday. The 23-year-old Norwegian won his semi-final match in 69 minutes. Ruud will face five-time champion Novak Djokovic on Sunday. He is 0-3 in head-to-head against the Serbian.

125.title: Lord Ram belongs to everyone, not just Hindus: Farooq Abdullah
125.article_body: Former J&K Chief Minister Farooq Abdullah warned people about political leaders who are attempting to create a religious divide in the valley, saying that Lord Ram belongs to everyone, not just Hindus. "They will use 'Hindu khatre mai hain' a lot during the elections...but I request you not fall prey to it," said Abdullah.

126.title: Girl chased by 3 dogs in Ghaziabad, narrowly escapes; video surfaces
126.article_body: An 11-year-old girl narrowly escaped being bitten by three stray dogs in Ghaziabad. In a CCTV footage of the incident, the girl can be seen running towards her society as the dogs aggressively chase her. Later in the video, one of the dogs was seen jumping and grabbing the girl's t-shirt, however, she managed to escape and enter the society.

127.title: I had strong opinions on being benched for T20 WC match vs Afghanistan: Starc
127.article_body: Australia pacer Mitchell Starc has revealed that he spoke to their chief selector George Bailey after being benched in their Super-12 stage match against Afghanistan in the recently concluded 2022 T20 World Cup. "I had strong opinions on it and had a conversation," said Starc. Australia had to defeat Afghanistan by a huge margin to qualify for the semi-finals.

128.title: Tim Southee becomes 2nd bowler to take a hat-trick against India in T20I cricket history
128.article_body: New Zealand pacer Tim Southee today became the second bowler to take a hat-trick against India in T20I cricket history. The 33-year-old dismissed Hardik Pandya, Deepak Hooda and Washington Sundar in India's last over in second T20I to take his second hat-trick in T20I cricket. Sri Lanka's Thisara Perera was the first bowler to take a T20I hat-trick against India.

129.title: We began with 2 people in 2018: Skyroot CEO after India's 1st private rocket launch
129.article_body: Pawan Kumar Chandana, the Co-founder and CEO of Hyderabad-based startup Skyroot Aerospace, shared a picture with his Co-founder Naga Bharath Daka on Twitter, and said, "I'd like to take a moment to remember our 'Prarambh' with just two people in 2018." His remark came after the startup's successful Mission Prarambh, marking the launch of India's first privately built rocket.

130.title: Is free electricity your right or revdi?: Kejriwal during MCD polls campaign
130.article_body: Campaigning for the upcoming MCD polls, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal asked people not to vote for those who want to stop the city’s development and welfare work. "Is free electricity your right or revdi? They want to stop free electricity in Delhi. But don’t worry, as long as Kejriwal is alive, electricity will be free," he said while addressing people.

131.title: 9 prisoners escape from Nagaland jail, massive search operation launched
131.article_body: At least nine inmates of Mon district jail in Nagaland escaped from prison following which a massive search operation is underway to trace them, police said on Sunday. The prisoners include under-trial inmates and murder convicts. They managed to escape in the early hours of Saturday after somehow getting hold of their cell keys, a police officer said.

132.title: Isha Ambani, husband Anand Piramal blessed with twins
132.article_body: Reliance Industries' Chairman Mukesh Ambani's daughter Isha Ambani and her husband Anand Piramal have been blessed with twins on Saturday, according to an official statement released by the Piramal and Ambani families. The statement further said that Isha and the babies, baby girl Aadiya and baby boy Krishna are doing well.

133.title: I've been dealing with different social issues through films: Ayushmann
133.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana, who is UNICEF India's celebrity advocate, said he believes in cinema for change. Speaking about what motivated him to join UNICEF, he said, "I'm proud of my filmography as well as I've been dealing with different social issues through...entertainment." He added, "But, if I can do something outside the realm of cinema for the children, that's great."

134.title: Robotic surgery used to operate on 18-yr-old with ovarian cysts in Mohali
134.article_body: A Chandigarh-based 18-year-old girl, who had ovarian cysts, was operated on through a robotic surgery in Mohali. Dr Swapna Misra, Director of the Obstetrics and Gynaecology Department, said that so far, ovary removal was the standardised treatment for women having cysts around their ovaries. However, robotic surgery was used to preserve the young patient's organs.

135.title: When lawyers strike, consumers of justice suffer: CJI amid protest in Guj
135.article_body: Even as the Gujarat High Court Advocates' Association is protesting the transfer of Justice Nikhil S Kariel to Patna, CJI DY Chandrachud said people suffer when lawyers strike. "When lawyers strike, the greatest sufferers are not the lawyers themselves, or the judges, but the consumers of justice, for whom the lawyers exist in the first place," he said.

136.title: There is nothing from Pant's side, Urvashi just wants someone to tease her: Shubman Gill
136.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant-Urvashi Rautela controversy, Team India batter Shubman Gill stated that Pant doesn't get distracted by it. "There is nothing from Pant's side. Urvashi just wants someone to tease her," Gill stated. "He does not even care about it," Gill added referring to Urvashi's apparent social media posts on Rishabh Pant.

137.title: Why is 2022 FIFA World Cup official match ball named 'Al Rihla'?
137.article_body: The official match ball for 2022 FIFA World Cup is named 'Al Rihla'. It's inspired by culture, architecture, iconic boats and flag of Qatar, FIFA said. 'Al Rihla' in Arabic means 'the journey'. The bold, vibrant colours set on pearlescent background represent Qatar. 'Al Rihla' travels faster in flight than any other ball in FIFA World Cup history, FIFA stated.

138.title: Left home to go to Kashmir at 13, police brought me home: Deepti Naval
138.article_body: Actress Deepti Naval shared that at the age of 13, when she used to live in Amritsar, she decided to "leave home and live in Kashmir". "I was going to take a bus to Jammu...But I got caught at Pathankot. The police brought me back to my parents," Deepti said. She added, "A complaint was also lodged back in Amritsar."

139.title: Hyderabad Police to launch special campaign against wrong-side driving
139.article_body: The Hyderabad Police will undertake a week-long awareness drive from tomorrow (November 21) and will launch a special campaign on November 28 against wrong-side driving and tripling on motorcycles by imposing hefty fines. Those violating the wrong-side driving rule will now have to pay a fine of ₹1,700 against the current penalty of ₹1,100, the police said.

140.title: Pujara receives Arjuna Award 5 years after recommendation, shares pic
140.article_body: India batter Cheteshwar Pujara collected his Arjuna Award on Saturday, five years after he was recommended for the honour in 2017. Pujara took to Twitter to share pictures from the ceremony and wrote, "Thankful to BCCI and Anurag Thakur to organise and handover the Arjuna Award belatedly, which I couldn't collect the year it was awarded...due to my cricket commitments."

141.title: Musk holds 'code review' meeting with Twitter engineers till 1:30 am
141.article_body: Elon Musk held a 'code review' meeting with engineers at Twitter's San Francisco headquarters till 1:30 am. He also posted his pictures with the employees on Twitter. Responding to a tweet saying, "Twitter is more alive at 1 am than it used to be during the daytime," Musk responded, "The most people I've ever seen in the building by far."

142.title: If lawyers protest against collegium decisions, where will it lead?: Rijiju
142.article_body: Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju criticised protests by lawyers against the recommendations of the Supreme Court collegium to transfer some High Court judges. "If this becomes a recurring instance...taken by the collegium, on which it's being supported by...government, then where will it lead," he asked. Recently, bar bodies in Gujarat, Telangana and Madras have protested the transfer decisions.

143.title: Pune records season's coldest morning on Sunday, temperature drops to 9.7°C
143.article_body: According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), Pune city on Sunday reported the coldest morning of the season when the temperature dropped to 9.7 degrees Celsius. Pune was cooler than Mahabaleshwar, Lonavala and Matheran this morning. Mahabaleshwar reported night temperature of 10.9 degrees Celsius, Lonavala 12.5 degrees Celsius and Matheran 17.2 degrees Celsius.

144.title: 7 suspended after filing independent nominations after not getting BJP tickets
144.article_body: The Bharatiya Janata Party has suspended seven people who had filed independent nominations for seats where the party did not allot them tickets for the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. The BJP leaders, including a sitting MLA and four former legislators, had filed nominations on Thursday as independents after being denied tickets by the party.

145.title: Mercedes-Benz to pay $5.5 mn to settle Arizona diesel ad case
145.article_body: Mercedes-Benz and auto supplier Robert Bosch have agreed to pay about $6 million to resolve a lawsuit accusing them of approving and marketing BlueTEC vehicles as "the most environmentally conscious diesel option" globally, the state of Arizona said. The firm will pay $2.8 million in consumer restitution. Each qualifying Arizona consumer will receive up to $625 per vehicle.

146.title: Pune City Police confiscates bar’s music system over noise pollution
146.article_body: The Pune City Police’s social security cell confiscated the music system and sound mixer, totalling ₹1.8 lakh, of Qora - Cocktail Bar and Kitchen in the Koregaon Park area for playing music beyond permissible noise levels. The action was taken under the Noise Pollution (Regulation and Control) Rules, 2000 and the Environment (Protection) Act, 1986, the cell said.

147.title: Suryakumar Yadav becomes first Indian to slam a T20I hundred on New Zealand soil
147.article_body: Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav today became the first-ever Indian batter to smash a T20I hundred on New Zealand soil. The 32-year-old reached the three-figure mark off 49 deliveries in second T20I against New Zealand at Bay Oval in Mount Maunganui. He's the second Indian batter to score two T20I centuries in a calendar year after Rohit Sharma in 2018.

148.title: KDMC demolishes office of Uddhav-led Shiv Sena in Mumbai's Kalyan
148.article_body: The Kalyan Dombivli Municipal Corporation (KDMC) demolished a public relations office of the Uddhav Thackeray-led faction of Shiv Sena after authorities declared it an illegal structure. KDMC claimed that it was constructed on a plot reserved for a playground. Several Shivsainiks protested against the action and said that the demolition was done under the pressure of Eknath Shinde-led government.

149.title: 7,500 people attend 1st day of Indian Racing League in Hyderabad
149.article_body: Nearly 7,500 people attended the first day of the two-day Indian Racing League on Saturday in Hyderabad. The league was flagged off by Telangana minister KTR. Twelve cars, six teams and four drivers participated in the race that was held on the 2.7 km-long Hyderabad Street Circuit. The Formula E race will be held in Hyderabad in February.

150.title: We've cracked sequel's premise: Vijayendra Prasad on 'RRR 2'
150.article_body: Days after director SS Rajamouli confirmed the sequel of 'RRR', his father and veteran writer KV Vijayendra Prasad has shared that the film's team has "cracked the sequel's premise". Earlier, during an event, Rajamouli had said that his father is "working on the story" of 'RRR 2'. The film ('RRR') starred Ram Charan and Jr NTR in the lead roles.

151.title: Elvis' biopic did him 'disservice', is 'inaccurate': Ex-girlfriend
151.article_body: Elvis Presley's ex-girlfriend Linda Thompson has said that the Baz Luhrmann's biopic film 'Elvis' has done a "disservice" to the late American music icon. She said the film has "many inaccurate and untrue elements," especially about the final years of Elvis' life. "Every time Elvis was hospitalised, I'd share his room...She (ex-wife Priscilla Presley) never even visited him," she shared.

152.title: Actress Aindrila Sharma passes away at 24
152.article_body: Bengali actress Aindrila Sharma died on Sunday at a hospital in Kolkata, where she was undergoing treatment after suffering multiple cardiac arrests earlier this week. She was 24. Aindrila was admitted to the hospital on November 1 after suffering a brain stroke. She had an intracranial hemorrhage and had to undergo left frontotemporoparietal de-compressive craniotomy surgery.

153.title: No truth to this: Hrithik on report claiming he's moving in with Saba in ₹100-cr house
153.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan took to Twitter to refute a report claiming that he will be moving into a new ₹100-crore apartment with his rumoured girlfriend Saba Azad. Hrithik tweeted, "There is no truth to this. As a public figure, I understand I'll be under the lens of curiosity, but it's best if we keep misinformation away".

154.title: 3 including director, HR of NGO Chilume arrested for voter data theft
154.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested three people, including one of the founder-directors and human resource (HR) official of the NGO Chilume Educational Cultural and Rural Development Trust, in connection with their investigation into alleged voter data theft in the city. The software developer, who allegedly created the 'Digital Sameeksha' app, was also reportedly taken into custody.

155.title: 3 transgenders selected as government school teachers in Karnataka
155.article_body: The Karnataka government has recruited three transgender teachers for state-run primary schools. "1% reservation was given in teacher recruitment for gender minorities. For the first time, three gender minorities have been selected," Education Minister BC Nagesh said. According to reports, a total of ten transgender people took the exam, out of which three were shortlisted.

156.title: Passenger was carrying explosives, had fake Aadhaar: Police on Mangaluru blast
156.article_body: In Mangaluru autorickshaw blast case, Karnataka Police has named the passenger as the prime suspect. DGP Praveen Sood said he was carrying explosives and also had a fake or stolen Aadhaar card. "Since he...got 40% burns, we have to wait before we can interrogate him," Sood added. Meanwhile, Karnataka minister Araga Jnanendra said the terror link will be revealed soon.

157.title: Virat Kohli, Anushka Sharma visit temple in Uttarakhand; pic goes viral
157.article_body: Virat Kolhi and Anushka Sharma recently visited Nainital, Uttarakhand for a break with their one-year-old daughter Vamika. Anushka and Virat also sought blessings at the Neem Karoli Baba Ashram in Kainchi Dham. They were clicked with a few local fans in Nainital and the photos have gone viral on social media.

158.title: I don't see any reason for it: Donald Trump on whether he'll return to Twitter
158.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump said, "I don't see any reason for it," when asked whether he planned to return to Twitter. He said he sees a "lot of problems" at Twitter and he will be staying on his own social media platform Truth Social. The comments came hours before Elon Musk reinstated Trump's Twitter account following a public poll.

159.title: Air India in talks with Boeing, Airbus to order new aircraft
159.article_body: Air India CEO Campbell Wilson has said the airline is in talks with Boeing and Airbus about ordering new aircraft. It aims to increase its market share to 30% on both domestic and international routes over the next five years. In September, Air India said it would lease 30 Boeing and Airbus planes, expanding its fleet by more than 25%.

160.title: 78 foreign nationals deported for illegal stay in Pune in last 4 years
160.article_body: As many as 78 foreign nationals have been deported for illegal stay in Pune in last four years, according to the data provided by the Pune City Police. Some of them engaged in various unauthorised activities, the officials stated. According to the data, 42 foreign nationals were deported in 2019, 25 in 2020, three in 2021 and eight in 2022.

161.title: China reports 1st COVID-19 death in almost 6 months amid rising cases
161.article_body:
China on Sunday reported its first new death from COVID-19 in almost six months. The death of an 87-year-old Beijing man was the first reported by the National Health Commission since May 26. 
Due to rising cases in the country, lockdowns and strict restrictions have been put in place. On Saturday, China reported 24,263 new cases.

162.title: Counting of votes in Nepal elections to begin at 9 pm today
162.article_body: Nepal's Chief Election Commissioner Dinesh Kumar Thapaliya said the votes polled to elect a new Parliament and provincial Assemblies will be counted from 9 pm on Sunday. The voting will close at 5 pm and the ballot boxes would be collected by 7 pm. Collecting ballot boxes from mountainous districts would take time hence its counting will begin on Monday.

163.title: Twitter working on restoring Trump's previous followers: Elon Musk
163.article_body: Twitter owner Elon Musk in response to a Twitter user asking for former President Donald Trump's previous followers to be restored, said, "Twitter engineering is working on it." The platform unbanned Trump's account on Sunday after Musk's poll saw 51.8% of over 15 million votes in favour of reinstatement. Trump's account reappeared on Twitter minutes after the poll ended.

164.title: Air India Mumbai-Calicut flight with 114 passengers delayed by 3 hrs
164.article_body: A Calicut-bound Air India flight from the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport in Mumbai was delayed by more than three hours on Sunday due to a technical issue, the airline said. There were 114 passengers on the flight. The aircraft came back at 6:25 am after push back at 6:13 am and finally departed at 9:50 am.

165.title: BJP’s criticism shows Bharat Jodo Yatra is a success: Cong
165.article_body: The Congress on Saturday said that criticism by the BJP of Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra and Rahul Gandhi is a clear indication of the yatra’s success.“The BJP targeting the Bharat Jodo Yatra is a clear indication…it’s troubling them very much,” Congress leader KC Venugopal said. “Why should we be worried, let them criticise,” he added.

166.title: AAP protests against potholes in B'luru, demands action against officials
166.article_body: AAP leaders protested in Bengaluru over the issue of potholes and asked the government to take action against officials. They demanded that the civic body make a promise to the citizens to fix all the potholes within a week. The party also demanded a compensation of ₹25 lakh for each family that lost loved ones in accidents due to potholes.

167.title: I stopped getting roles when I got married, it caused me depression: Deepti Naval
167.article_body: Actress Deepti Naval has said she went through depression when she stopped getting offers after her marriage. She said, "It was as if my talent had been completely washed out...There were several years when I had no work. That was one of the things that caused me depression." Deepti married Prakash Jha in 1985, however, they got divorced in 2002.

168.title: Who are the past winners of FIFA World Cup?
168.article_body: Uruguay had won the first-ever FIFA World Cup in 1930. Brazil have won FIFA World Cup for the most number of times (five). The last five FIFA World Cups have been won by five different teams (France, Germany, Spain, Italy and Brazil). The 1958 final, which Brazil won 5-2 against Sweden, was the highest-scoring final in FIFA World Cup history.

169.title: Punjabi singer Tari Kasapuria booked for releasing '32 bore' song promoting gun culture
169.article_body: Punjabi singer Tari Kasapuria, producer Satta DK and owners of Love Music company have been booked in Ludhiana for releasing the song '32 bore' after the Punjab government banned songs glorifying weapons. Police said that the song was being shared on social media after its release on YouTube, and it glorifies weapons in the video as well as its lyrics.

170.title: Don't buy TV, fridge, car, hold on to your money: Bezos as he warns of recession
170.article_body: Amazon Founder and world's fourth-richest person Jeff Bezos urged people to consider not making large purchases as the "economy does not look good right now". In a recent interview, Bezos warned of a recession and asked American families to postpone purchase of items like big-screen TV, automobile, and refrigerator. "Hold onto your money, and see what transpires," the entrepreneur added.

171.title: Women, kids worked as whistleblowers for Swachh Bharat: Jal Shakti Minister
171.article_body: Union Jal Shakti Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said that women and children worked like whistleblowers for the 'Swachh Bharat Mission'. "People's participation was most important for us and India owes its success to people who adopted this campaign relentlessly. It was women and children of the country, especially from small towns and villages, who became real change makers," Shekhawat said.

172.title: Flipkart denies posting job vacancy copied from Aus firm, says 'Our team didn't post this'
172.article_body: A job opening posted by Flipkart on LinkedIn appeared to have been copied from a similar vacancy shared by an Australian software company Atlassian. Replying to a LinkedIn user's post about the 'Head of Design' job opening, Flipkart said that no such role exists in the company and that no one from their recruitment team was involved in posting this.

173.title: Pregnant dog beaten to death, body dragged across field in Delhi; FIR filed
173.article_body: A pregnant dog was tortured to death by more than 25 students and staff members suspected to be of Don Bosco Technical Institute in South East Delhi, officials said. The video of the incident went viral in which the dog was seen being dragged across the field in the college compound. The New Friends Colony Police registered an FIR.

174.title: Electric meter tampering cases on rise in Pune
174.article_body: The number of meter tampering activities are on rise in Pune as Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Co. Ltd (MSEDCL) reported 5,719 cases of electricity theft and 1,591 cases of unauthorised use of electricity in the last 6 months. The electricity theft amounted to ₹16.07 crore while unauthorised use of electricity worth ₹6.43 crore was reported during this period.

175.title: Tabassum's last wish was to not inform about her death for at least 2 days: Govil
175.article_body: Tabassum's brother-in-law and actor Arun Govil shared that the veteran actress' last wish was to "not inform anyone about her demise for at least two days". "Her last rites were performed yesterday. She had a peaceful last journey," he shared. He informed that Tabassum, who passed away on Friday due to cardiac arrest, also suffered from some gastrointestinal problems.

176.title: Physiotherapists association condemns Sisodia's claim on Jain's massage video in jail
176.article_body: The Indian Association of Physiotherapists has refuted Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia's claim of "physiotherapy treatment" on the leaked video of Satyendar Jain getting a massage in Tihar Jail.
