"IAP strongly condemns the statement of the minister degrading physiotherapy...Shows the level of education and knowledge to them about our noble profession," the association said.

177.title: Bihar woman alleges 'love jihad', says 'Family forcing her to eat beef'
177.article_body: A Hindu woman, Julie, in Bihar has accused her husband of 'love jihad' and claimed that the man was pressuring her to convert to Islam. "One day I came to know...that he is Tauquir, not Raj Singh...His entire family…[is] forcing me to eat beef...He is threatening that he will kill my entire family," said Julie.

178.title: Thank you for coming into my life: Shehnaaz remembers Sidharth Shukla
178.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill, who won an award at a recently held award function, remembered late actor Sidharth Shukla and thanked him for coming into her life. "You have invested so much in me that today I've reached here," she said in Hindi. The video of her speech at the award show went viral on social media platforms.

179.title: India announce their playing XI for 2nd T20I against New Zealand
179.article_body: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson won the toss and elected to bowl first in the second T20I against India at the Bay Oval in Mount Maunganui. India's playing XI includes Ishan Kishan, Rishabh Pant, Shreyas Iyer, Deepak Hooda, Washington Sundar and Yuzvendra Chahal. The first T20I was abandoned due to rain in Wellington.

180.title: India reports 492 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 6,489
180.article_body: India reported 492 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after India reported 556 fresh COVID-19 cases. The number of active COVID-19 cases in the country stands at 6,489. The death toll so far has reached 5,30,574, according to the ministry.

181.title: Woman caught with cocaine worth ₹3.6 crore hidden in wheelchair tyres in US
181.article_body: A woman was arrested at JFK Airport in New York after she allegedly tried to smuggle 28 pounds of cocaine with an estimated value of $450,000 (₹3.6 crore) in the tyres of her wheelchair. Customs officials stopped the woman after they noticed the wheels of her wheelchair weren't spinning properly. A Dominican national, she now faces federal narcotics smuggling charges.

182.title: Musk made it clear he'll be calling the shots: Twitter ex-executive on why he quit
182.article_body: Twitter's former Head of Safety and Trust Yoel Roth penned an article explaining reasons for his departure. He wrote that he ultimately left Twitter because Elon Musk "made clear that at the end of the day, he'll be the one calling the shots". "A Twitter whose policies are defined by edict has little need for...trust and safety function," he added.

183.title: Those who defame Gujarat should not find place in state: PM Modi
183.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while addressing a rally in Gujarat’s Valsad district on Saturday, appealed to people to be wary of those who defame Gujarat and said they should not find a place in the state. "We can never accept those who try to take Gujarat in reverse gear...They are trying to defame Gujarat and Gujaratis," PM Modi added.

184.title: One of India's most-wanted terrorist Rinda died of drug overdose in Pak: Reports
184.article_body: Harvinder Singh Sandhu alias Rinda, a most-wanted terrorist carrying a reward of ₹10 lakh, has reportedly died at a hospital in Lahore. Rinda, who was under the protection of Pakistan's ISI, was reportedly being treated for a kidney ailment triggered by drug overdose. Rinda was the mastermind behind the RPG attack on Punjab Police's Intelligence headquarters at Mohali this year.

185.title: Car catches fire in parking lot of Hyderabad Airport, driver jumps out
185.article_body: A fire broke out in a car when it reached the parking area of Hyderabad Airport, reports said. The car caught fire when the driver was about to park it in the parking area of the airport. The driver reportedly jumped out of car when he realised it was on fire. Some other vehicles near the car also caught fire.

186.title: Britain knows what it means to fight for freedom: Sunak in Ukraine
186.article_body: On his maiden visit to Ukraine after assuming office, UK PM Rishi Sunak said Britain knows what it means to fight for freedom. "We are with you all the way Volodymyr Zelenskyy," he tweeted, expressing UK's support for Ukraine in war against Russia. Thanking Sunak, Zelenskyy tweeted, "With friends like you by our side, we are confident in our victory."

187.title: PM Modi visits Somnath Temple on trip to Gujarat, pics surface
187.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday visited the Somnath Temple in Gujarat and offered prayers to the Aadi Jyotirling. Notably, PM Modi is also the Chairman of the temple's trust. He is scheduled to visit the Saurashtra region and will address rallies in  Veraval, Dhoraji, Amreli and Botad. On Monday, he will address rallies in Surendranagar, Bharuch and Navsari.

188.title: We are underestimating Elon Musk's genius: Harsh Goenka
188.article_body: Businessman Harsh Goenka said people are "underestimating the genius of Elon Musk". Stating that there must be "a method to his madness", Goenka noted that Musk was ahead of his time with his other companies like Tesla, SpaceX and The Boring Company. "He surely has a game plan with Twitter...Let's give him time before we predict its death," Goenka tweeted.

189.title: Cong against development: Vijay Rupani on Patkar joining Bharat Jodo Yatra
189.article_body: After activist Medha Patkar joined 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Maharashtra, former Gujarat CM Vijay Rupani said that Patkar's participation in the Congress' 'padayatra' shows that the party is against development. "Medha Patkar was the person who opposed [the] Narmada dam project. She protested over it and created obstacles in the state's development," said Rupani.

190.title: Athiya-KL Rahul's wedding will happen very soon: Suniel Shetty
190.article_body: Suniel Shetty has confirmed his daughter and actress Athiya Shetty will soon marry cricketer KL Rahul. At the Dharavi Bank launch event, reporters asked Suniel Shetty when Athiya Shetty would be getting married to KL Rahul, to which the actor answered, "Jaldi hogi". The couple has reportedly been in relationship for the past three years.

191.title: Cisco to lay off over 4,000 employees in a 'rebalancing' move: Report
191.article_body: Cisco is reportedly laying off over 4,000 employees, or about 5% of its workforce. According to a report, while Cisco CEO termed it as "rightsizing certain businesses", CFO Scott Herren said, "Don't think of this as a headcount action that is motivated by cost savings. This really is a rebalancing." Recently, Twitter, Meta and Amazon had announced job cuts.

192.title: John Abraham to star in Abhishek Sharma's science-fiction film Parlok
192.article_body: Director Abhishek Sharma has confirmed that he is teaming up with John Abraham for his upcoming film, titled 'Parlok', which will be a "science-fiction film". "It's a fantastic story we both want to tell...this is going to be a new world for me to explore as a director," Sharma said, adding that John will also produce the film.

193.title: Bihar CM to be gheraoed if he fails to fulfil job promise: Prashant Kishor
193.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor said Bihar CM Nitish Kumar will be gheraoed if he fails to fulfil his promise of providing "10 lakh government jobs" to the youth of Bihar in the coming days. "The CM, during his Independence Day speech...had promised that the grand alliance government aimed at providing jobs to 10 lakh people in government sector," Kishor added.

194.title: B'luru Police issues advisory banning heavy vehicles near Hebbal flyover
194.article_body: The Bengaluru Traffic Police announced a ban on heavy vehicles between the Sadahalli toll gate and the Hebbal junction to facilitate ease of commute between the Bengaluru International Airport and the city during peak hours. The ban will be effective between 8.30 am and 10.30 am every day, according to the order issued by new Bengaluru Traffic Special Commissioner.

195.title: Nepal to sell 5 Chinese planes over breakdowns, lack of pilots: Report
195.article_body: State-owned Nepal Airlines has decided to sell five Chinese planes due to breakdowns and a lack of pilots, a report said. In September, the three 17-seater and two 56-seater aircraft were put for lease for bidders. The deadline of October 31 was extended to November 16 but Nepal Airlines didn't get a single bid even after the extension.

196.title: 7 people try getting on 2-wheeler; Delhi police share video, say 'Only for 2'
196.article_body: Delhi Police shared a video of seven people trying to get on one two-wheeler. "Lest the world of happiness gets ruined...Two-wheelers are only...for two people," police wrote. In the video, a woman can be seen making a child sit on a bike while two people are already on it. Two children and two women can be seen waiting.

197.title: Staff leaving Twitter after Musk's mail share pics of laptops with blue bird stickers
197.article_body: Several employees who chose to quit after Elon Musk's mail about the company's "hardcore culture", tweeted photos of their laptops with blue bird stickers and memorabilia. A former employee also tweeted, "I may be exceptional but...I’m just not hardcore." In the email, Musk had asked staff to commit to a "new Twitter" or leave with three months of severance pay.

198.title: Madras HC prevents 12,000 websites from streaming FIFA WC illegally
198.article_body: The Madras High Court on Friday restrained over 12,000 websites from streaming the FIFA World Cup 2022 illegally. Justice M Sundar granted the injunction while passing interim orders on an application arising out of a civil suit filed by Viacom 18. Viacom 18 said it has transmission rights for Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka.

199.title: Act of terror, not accidental: K'taka DGP on autorickshaw blast in Mangaluru
199.article_body: Karnataka DGP Praveen Sood said on Sunday that the explosion in an autorickshaw in Mangaluru was not accidental but an act of terror. The intention was to cause serious damage, he added. "Karnataka State Police is probing deep into it along with central agencies," Sood tweeted. The autorickshaw driver and a passenger sustained injuries after the vehicle exploded.

200.title: Retired professor cheated of ₹20 lakh by cyber fraudsters in Pune
200.article_body: A 74-year-old retired professor was cheated of ₹20 lakh in an online fraud in Pune. "On the pretext of helping the senior citizen to complete her KYC update, the fraudster tricked the complainant into giving her debit card details, including the CVV number," said a police officer. The accused also hacked her mobile phone by making her download an application.

201.title: Waymo gets permit to offer driverless test rides in California
201.article_body: Alphabet's self-driving vehicles unit Waymo has received California Public Utilities Commission's permit to participate in a driverless pilot programme. Under the programme, passengers will be able to ride in test autonomous vehicles operating without a driver. With this permit, Waymo may offer driverless passenger service throughout San Francisco and portions of Palo Alto, among other cities.

202.title: Split coaching after 2023 ODI WC has high plausibility: Dinesh Karthik
202.article_body: With Ravi Shastri criticising India head coach Rahul Dravid for taking a break for the New Zealand tour, wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said that "split coaching" could be the way forward, considering the amount of cricket being played. "It's something which India needs to look into after the 2023 ODI World Cup when the contract is up for renewal," stated Karthik.

203.title: Son of retired constable cheats people in Thane wearing fake uniform, arrested
203.article_body: A 41-year-old man was arrested in Thane for wearing fake police officer's uniform and cheating people. The accused, son of a retired police constable, wanted to become a police officer but failed to do so. He would stop cars and extort money for any violations. He also cheated a woman who fell in love with him believing his fake identity.

204.title: Ballon d'Or winner Karim Benzema ruled out of 2022 FIFA World Cup
204.article_body: France striker Karim Benzema, who won the Ballon d'Or award this year, has been ruled out of 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar after tearing a muscle in his left thigh during training on Saturday. It will now be the first time since 1978 that the reigning Ballon d'Or winner will not feature in the World Cup.

205.title: Such crimes committed due to access to material on internet: Bombay HC CJ on Shraddha case
205.article_body: Referring to Mumbai woman Shraddha Walkar's murder by her live-in partner Aftab Poonawala in Delhi, Bombay High Court Chief Justice Dipankar Datta said, "All these crimes are being committed because there is so much access to the material on the internet." He added, "The Indian Telecommunication bill is there and we require certain robust legislation to tackle all the situations."

206.title: Couldn't prevent my son from committing suicide, felt guilty: Kabir Bedi
206.article_body: Actor Kabir Bedi said he feels guilty that he couldn't prevent his son Siddharth Bedi "from committing suicide". Siddharth took his own life in 1997, at the age of 25, after being diagnosed with schizophrenia. Kabir also spoke about the time when he went through financial disasters and suffered great losses due to bad investments.

207.title: Judges at grassroots reluctant to grant bail due to fear of being targeted: CJI
207.article_body: CJI DY Chandrachud on Saturday said judges at the grassroots are reluctant to grant bail due to the sense of fear of being targeted for granting bail in heinous cases. "The higher judiciary is flooded with bail applications due to reluctance at grassroots to grant bail," CJI Chandrachud said at a felicitation event organised by the Bar Council of India.

208.title: Dismantling of Carnac Bridge starts in Mumbai, Central Railway shares video
208.article_body: The dismantling of Carnac Bridge has started in Mumbai. The Central Railway took to Twitter to share a video of the process. "Dawn of the day. Dismantling in progress," the Central Railway wrote. A Central Railway official said that the bridge will be cut into 44 pieces using gas cutters and gas cylinders in a 27-hour operation.

209.title: Don't be swayed by what Musk's selling, it doesn't fit your type: Ashneer to founders
209.article_body: Addressing the mass layoffs taking place globally, 'Shark Tank India' investor Ashneer Grover urged startup founders not to get "swayed by what Elon Musk is selling as couture" as "it does not fit your body type". He suggested that founders should reduce salaries by 25% rather than conducting mass layoffs. "It's a better solution as rehiring will be...costly," Grover added.

210.title: People with no contribution to country shouldn't question Savarkar: Assam CM
210.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma criticised Congress MP Rahul Gandhi over his remarks against VD Savarkar and said that people who have made no contribution to the country should not question freedom fighters. "Savarkar spent many years in jail…It is a sin to question Savarkar's contribution. Rahul Gandhi should not [commit] this sin," said Sarma.

211.title: Court says Mumbai driver applied brakes due to speed breaker in 9-yr-old case
211.article_body: A magistrate court has acquitted an auto driver in a nine-year-old rash driving case, alleging that he applied brakes to avert an accident after he saw an unmarked speed breaker 10 feet away. A mother and son travelling in his auto had sustained injuries when it skid and fell on its side. A complaint had been registered.

212.title: 2 arrested for posing as GST officials, cheat people of ₹28 cr in Hyd
212.article_body: The Cyberabad Special Operations Team arrested two persons, posing as GST officials, for allegedly cheating 18 persons to the tune of ₹28 crore. They approached people, saying they could help them get gold and other expensive items seized by the customs department at lower prices. DCP (Balanagar), G Sandeep, said they would collect huge amounts from the victims and escape.

213.title: It wasn't poor bowling from India, just a chasable target: Hales on T20 WC semis
213.article_body: England batter Alex Hales, on being asked about their 2022 T20 World Cup semi-final match, said  India were "30 runs short" in the match. "Chasing a total of 160 or 170 is a little bit easy at Adelaide...I don't necessarily think it was poor bowling from India," added Hales. England chased down India's 169-run target without losing a single wicket.

214.title: Pay disparity exists because of 'insecurity of a man': Jaya Bachchan
214.article_body: Actress-politician Jaya Bachchan said that the pay disparity, which exists in every field, "is an outcome" of men's "insecurity". "He's (man is) insecure, which is why he feels it's easier to put a woman down...in every way," she mentioned. Shweta Bachchan said the issue (of pay parity) needs to be addressed as women are "making an equal impact as men".

215.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face 12-hr water cut tomorrow
215.article_body: Parts of South Bengaluru will be facing water supply disruptions tomorrow (November 21) from 6 am to 6 pm. The water supply will be stopped to carry out work on shifting supply lines of various diameters near Metro construction sites laid by BWSSB (Bangalore Water Supply and Sewerage Board) from KR Puram to Silk Board along the Outer Ring Road.

216.title: China urging military veterans to work at iPhone factory to boost production: Reports
216.article_body: Chinese government officials are reportedly urging retired military staff to help boost production at the Apple iPhone maker Foxconn’s factory in Zhengzhou as its production got hit by COVID-19-related restrictions. A Veteran Affairs Bureau of the People's Liberation Army in the plant's province said veterans were always under Communist Party's command and should "show up where there's a need".

217.title: BJP's top leaders to hold 14 roadshows for MCD polls in Delhi today
217.article_body: Ahead of MCD polls in Delhi, BJP has planned 14 roadshows led by several top leaders today to woo voters. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, BJP chief JP Nadda, Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur, Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami, Haryana CM ML Khattar, Union MoS Jitendra Singh and MoS Meenakashi Lekhi are among the ones enlisted for the campaign.

218.title: Bengal man barks at officer after ration card printed with surname 'Kutta', video goes viral
218.article_body: A man named Srikanti Kumar Dutta in West Bengal's Bankura district behaved like a dog by 'barking' at a local block development officer after his surname on the ration card was misspelt as 'Kutta' (dog) instead of 'Dutta'. A video of the incident has gone viral. Dutta said his name was misprinted thrice and he was mentally disturbed by this.

219.title: 45-yr-old Pune woman cycles 3,955 km from Koteshwar to Kibithoo in 13 days
219.article_body: A Pune-based 45-year-old woman, Preeti Maske, covered a distance of 3,955 km from the Indo-Pak border at Koteshwar to reach Kibithoo in Arunachal Pradesh on the Indo-Tibetan border on a cycle in 13 days, 19 hours and 12 minutes. Reports said that she completed her journey at 12:19 am on November 15. The 3,955 km long trip covered seven states.

220.title: Mumbai local train services hit due to 27-hr mega block for bridge demolition
220.article_body: Local train services in Mumbai will remain affected as the Central Railway (CR) has announced a 27-hour mega block from 11 pm on November 19 to 2 am on November 21 for the demolition work of British-era Carnac Bridge. The block will be operated for 17 hours on the Main line and for 21 hours on the Harbour line.

221.title: Biden's granddaughter Naomi marries Peter Neal at White House; pics surface
221.article_body: US President Joe Biden's granddaughter Naomi Biden and Peter Neal were married in a private ceremony at the White House on Saturday. The event marked the 19th wedding in the 200-plus years of White House history. "It has been a joy to watch Naomi grow...[and] carve out such an incredible life for herself," Biden and first lady Jill said.

222.title: Donald Trump's account reappears on Twitter 22 months after it was banned
222.article_body: Former President Donald Trump's Twitter account was visible again on Sunday, shortly after Elon Musk announced he would be reinstated on the platform. The @realDonaldTrump account, including its previous tweets, reappeared 22 months after it was permanently suspended due to risk of further incitement of violence. "The people have spoken," wrote Musk on the results of a personal Twitter poll.

223.title: 3 Humboldt penguins born in Byculla zoo in 7 months named Flash, Bingo, Alexa
223.article_body: Three Humboldt penguins who were born in Mumbai's Byculla Zoo in last seven months have been named Flash, Bingo and Alexa. Male chicks, Flash and Bingo, were born on April 2 and 26 respectively. Female chick, Alexa, was born on August 9. Penguins Donald and Daisy gave birth to Flash and Alexa, while Bingo was born to Molt and Flipper.

224.title: SpaceX to launch Japan-based ispace's M1 lunar lander on Nov 28
224.article_body: SpaceX is scheduled to launch Japan-based ispace's M1 lunar lander, part of the HAKUTO-R lunar exploration program, on November 28. Following landing, Hakuto-R's M1 will deploy a small United Arab Emirates rover, called Rashid. The firm has chosen the Atlas Crater at Mare Frigoris to the far north of the Moon as its primary landing site.

225.title: Elon Musk considers firing more Twitter employees: Report
225.article_body: Elon Musk is reportedly considering firing more Twitter employees as soon as Monday, days after hundreds of employees resigned by declining to accept the billionaire's ultimatum of an "extremely hardcore" culture. The new round of layoffs will likely target the sales and partnerships teams, Bloomberg reported. Musk has fired two executives who refused to fire more employees, the report said.

226.title: Amazon-owned Wickr Me messaging app to shut down next year
226.article_body: Amazon's AWS-owned Wickr Me messaging app will shut down on December 31, 2023. Wickr said the app will stop accepting new user registrations after December 31, 2022, before shutting down permanently next year. Earlier this year, a report suggested that Wickr Me had become "a go-to destination for people to exchange images of child sexual abuse".

227.title: Donald Trump will be reinstated on Twitter, confirms Elon Musk
227.article_body: Elon Musk confirmed on Sunday morning that former US President Donald Trump's Twitter account will be reinstated. The decision was announced after 51.8% of over 15 million users voted in favour of unbanning Trump's account on a poll held by Musk. "The people have spoken," Musk wrote. Trump's Twitter account was suspended after last year's attack on the US Capitol.

228.title: Messi-led Argentina staying at Qatar University instead of hotel due to barbecue: Reports
228.article_body: Lionel Messi-led Argentina are staying at Qatar University instead of 5-star hotel so they can have their traditional beef barbecues during FIFA World Cup 2022, as per reports. "We visited...campus several times and chose it because not only does it have great facilities but it also has open-air space for Asados (Argentinian custom of barbecue)," an Argentina FA official said.

229.title: 5 injured in Russian strike on aid station: Ukrainian Prez's aide
229.article_body: Five people were injured in a Russian strike on a humanitarian station in southern Ukraine, Kyrylo Tymoshenko, a senior Ukrainian presidential aide, said on Saturday. He said the centre had been handing out bread. The attack took place in a town just west of the city of Kherson, which Ukrainian troops recaptured from Russian forces last week, Tymoshenko informed.

230.title: Bulgaria charges 5 people over blast in Turkey's Istanbul
230.article_body: Bulgaria has charged five people, including a woman of Syrian Kurdish origin, in connection with the blast in Turkey's Istanbul on Sunday that killed six people, prosecutors said. The suspects were detained earlier this week, Bulgaria's chief prosecutor Ivan Geshev said on Saturday. They have been charged with "supporting terrorist acts in another country" and "human trafficking", Geshev added.

231.title: Four-time champion Sebastian Vettel qualifies 9th for final F1 race
231.article_body: Aston Martin driver and four-time F1 world champion Sebastian Vettel qualified ninth for Sunday's 2022 season-ending Abu Dhabi Grand Prix. "I'm still in the zone now, but I'm sure it will be a big day tomorrow," said Vettel, who retires after the race. Red Bull's Max Verstappen took the pole position, ahead of teammate Sergio Perez and Ferrari's Charles Leclerc.

232.title: UK PM Sunak pays surprise visit to Kyiv, announces defence package
232.article_body: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak on Saturday paid a surprise visit to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in Kyiv. Sunak also announced a fresh air defence package for Ukraine, which Britain valued at $60 million. Zelenskyy posted a video of the meeting online, where the two leaders are seen smiling and shaking hands before beginning discussions on the Russian invasion.

233.title: If I play well, no one can stop me from getting into hockey WC team: Sumit
233.article_body: Indian midfielder Sumit said that if he plays well then no one can stop him from getting into the national squad for the FIH Men's Hockey World Cup 2023 in January. "The Australia tour is really important before the WC...Australia is a really strong team [and] we will get good competition from them," 25-year-old Sumit said.

234.title: Not interested in Ronaldo's form, he's hungry to score: Portugal manager
234.article_body: Portugal manager Fernando Santos said he is "not interested in" Cristiano Ronaldo's recent form and believes the forward is "hungry" to score goals. "He has always been hungry - that's why he has stayed at the top of the game for so long," said Santos. He added that Ronaldo has a "huge hunger" to "make Portugal the world champions".

235.title: We're keen to begin talks with India on trade in digital services: Aus minister
235.article_body: Australia is keen to begin discussions with India on trade in digital services under a Comprehensive Economic Cooperation Agreement, Australia's Assistant Minister for Foreign Affairs Tim Watts said. He added that Australia "believes digital trade is a really worthwhile agenda". Watts stated that the responsible ministers from both nations had committed to starting negotiations in coming months.

236.title: Indira Gandhi was fiercely committed to all-inclusive patriotism: Sonia
236.article_body: On the occasion of ex-PM Indira Gandhi's birth anniversary, Congress MP Sonia Gandhi said that the former was fiercely committed to "all-inclusive patriotism". Sonia said that even Indira's critics recognised the "unchanging core of her personality, that defined who she was and what she did". Notably, Sonia was speaking at the Indira Gandhi Peace Prize ceremony in New Delhi.

237.title: Malaysia's ex-PM Mahathir suffers 1st election defeat in 53 years
237.article_body: Malaysia's 97-year-old former prime minister Mahathir Mohamad suffered his first election loss in 53 years on Saturday. Mahathir failed to retain his Langkawi island constituency in the Parliamentary election. Mohd Suhaimi Abdullah from the Perikatan alliance won the Langkawi island seat. The Perikatan alliance is led by former prime minister Muhyiddin Yassin.

238.title: Early winter snowstorm claims 2 lives in US' New York state
238.article_body: Two persons have died in the US' New York state due to heavy snowing. The snowstorm was described as an early winter "lake effect" from Lake Erie and Lake Ontario, which dumped about 4 feet of snow on Friday, Reuters news agency reported. Officials said the deaths occurred due to heart attacks caused by overexertion while clearing snow.

239.title: Suspected Congolese soldier killed after crossing border: Rwanda
239.article_body: A man wearing a Congolese army uniform was shot dead by Rwandan troops on Saturday, Rwanda's military said. After crossing into the Rwandan side of the Rwanda-Congo border, the unidentified soldier started firing at Rwandan guard towers, following which he was neutralised, the military added. Congolese officials said that no soldier on duty in the area had been reported missing.

240.title: Congress to distribute 100,000 copies of Constitution in Maharashtra
240.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Saturday launched a campaign to distribute 100,000 copies of the Indian Constitution to the people of Maharashtra under the 'Save Democracy' initiative. The programme has been taken up by the Maharashtra Congress Scheduled Caste Department, which is led by Siddharth Hattiambire. The leader said the Constitution is under severe threat owing to the BJP government.

241.title: RCB's first IPL title will lead to more titles quickly: De Villiers
241.article_body: Former South African batter AB de Villiers said if Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) win their first IPL title, they could win quite a few rather quickly. "I think if RCB wins one then they'll probably win two, three, four quickly...hopefully RCB's turn is around the corner," said de Villiers. He added that T20 cricket is a "bit of a gamble".

242.title: Student groups clash outside university campus in Punjab, 4 injured
242.article_body: Four students sustained injuries when two groups allegedly clashed outside CT University campus in Punjab's Ludhiana district during a convocation ceremony on Friday. The clash allegedly took place between current and former students over some comments on an Instagram post. Punjab Assembly Speaker Kultar Singh Sandhwan was the chief guest at the convocation.

243.title: Video shows girl students making chapatis in Punjab school; probe on
243.article_body: A video showing some girl students of a government school in Punjab making chapatis has gone viral on social media. The students were reportedly making chapatis for mid-day meal in school. The school is located in Pathankot's Sujanpur. The school's principal said that an investigation is being conducted into the incident.

244.title: Wimbledon to allow female players dress code exemption over period concerns
244.article_body: Wimbledon will allow female players to wear dark-coloured undershorts from next year to ease anxiety over playing during their period. Wimbledon chief executive Sally Bolton said, "We're committed to supporting players and listening to their feedback." She added, "It's our hope that this rule adjustment will help players focus purely on...performance by relieving a potential source of anxiety."

245.title: If not us, would want to see Messi or Suarez win FIFA WC: Spain coach
245.article_body: Spain coach Luis Enrique said if his team doesn't win the FIFA World Cup, then he would like to see Lionel Messi's Argentina or Luis Suarez's Uruguay crowned champions. He added that "it would be very unfair" for Messi to retire without a World Cup. Enrique added that Spain has guessed who they will face in the Round of 16.

246.title: 5-time champion Djokovic defeats Fritz to reach final of ATP Finals
246.article_body: Five-time champion Novak Djokovic beat American Taylor Fritz 7-6(7-5), 7-6(8-6) in the semi-final of the ATP Finals in Turin on Saturday. "I didn't feel very reactive today or very comfortable...I am very pleased to have overcome this one," said Djokovic. The Serbian won his last Red Group match against Daniil Medvedev in three hours and 11 minutes on Friday.

247.title: Beating higher-ranked players at Asian Cup was an achievement for me: Manika
247.article_body: Following Manika Batra's bronze medal win after beating world number six Hina Hayata at Asian Cup, the world number 44 said defeating higher-ranked players was an achievement for her. The 27-year-old became the first-ever Indian woman paddler to win a medal in the tournament. Manika beat world number seven Chen Xingtong in pre-quarterfinal. She defeated 23rd-ranked Chen Szu-Yu in quarter-final.

248.title: Rohit Shetty took 4 years to get script right: Vivek on 'Indian Police...'
248.article_body: Vivek Oberoi, speaking about his upcoming web series 'Indian Police Force', said it's loaded with Rohit Shetty's signature larger-than-life narrative but the director has also adopted a realistic approach for the show. He added Rohit took four years to get the script right. "The scale, the passion with which Rohit has made this...he'll set a benchmark with [it]," said Vivek.

249.title: Was overwhelmed: Nishikori on shedding a tear for Federer at Tokyo event
249.article_body: Explaining why he shed a tear after meeting Roger Federer at an event in Tokyo, 2014 US Open runner-up Kei Nishikori said, "I was overwhelmed by the atmosphere." "And also my admiration for him. After that I've started considering him an opponent to beat though he's my idol," he added. It was Federer's first exhibition match since retiring from tennis.

250.title: Your legacy will live forever: Tabassum's granddaughter on actress' death
250.article_body: Tabassum's granddaughter Karishma Govil took to Instagram on Saturday to share a post remembering the late actress. "Rest in peace, dadiji. Your smile, tenacity and legacy will live forever," she wrote, sharing some old pictures with her grandmother. Tabassum, who hosted the celebrity talk show 'Phool Khile Hain Gulshan Gulshan', passed away after suffering a cardiac arrest on Friday.

251.title: 'Trace, Target, Terminate' policy needed for all economic crimes: Shah
251.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said that the strategy of 'Trace, Target and Terminate' needs to be adopted for every level of economic crime. He made the remarks while addressing the 'No Money for Terror' Ministerial Conference on Counter-Terrorism Financing. India has decided to develop national and global databases on narcotics and economic offences, and terrorism, Shah added.

252.title: 5, including 3 BSF personnel, arrested for gang-rape in Rajasthan
252.article_body: Five men were arrested for allegedly gang-raping a woman in Sri Ganganagar, Rajasthan. The accused include one head constable and two constables of the Border Security Force. "The 35-year-old victim...said that persons known to her took her to a place on the pretext of buying her ghee...The accused took her to a secluded place...[and] then raped her," an official said.

253.title: 8 men arrested for smuggling red sandalwood logs in Tirupati
253.article_body: Police arrested eight men for allegedly smuggling red sandalwood logs in Tirupati, Andhra Pradesh. "[We have] seized 85 red sandalwood logs from three areas of Tirupati. Four two-wheelers and one goods carrier [have] also [been] seized," said Circle Inspector, Ramakrishna. He added, "Search [operation] launched for smugglers who absconded [and] a case [has been] registered."

254.title: 25-yr-old hoists Chhattisgarhiya Olympic flag at Mt Friendship peak
254.article_body: A 25-year-old man named Chaman Lal Kose hoisted the Chhattisgarhiya Olympic flag at the peak of Mount Friendship, Himachal Pradesh, on Wednesday. The Chhattisgarh resident also raised another flag dedicated to CM Bhupesh Baghel. Kose said scaling the peak wasn't easy and his expedition was hit by avalanches. The peak lies at a height of 17,353 feet above sea level.

255.title: Censor board asks 'Bhediya' producers to change abusive words to 'gadha', 'sansad' to 'body'
255.article_body: The Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) has asked the makers of 'Bhediya' to change certain abusive words in the movie to "gadha". It also asked the makers to replace 'Ganga Jamuna mix' with 'Ganga Jamuna juice'. It further asked them to change 'sansad' to 'body', 'PMO' to 'minister' and 'country' to 'logo'.

256.title: Brett Lee names his Best XI of T20 World Cup 2022, includes 4 Indians
256.article_body: Former Australia fast bowler Brett Lee has named his Best XI of T20 World Cup 2022, which includes four Indians. He included Alex Hales and Jos Buttler as openers, followed by Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav and Glenn Phillips. Other players in the team include Hardik Pandya, Shadab Khan, Sam Curran, Shaheen Afridi, Arshdeep Singh and Adil Rashid.

257.title: Prithvi Shaw is naturally destructive, simply flies: Aakash Chopra
257.article_body: Ex-Indian cricketer Aakash Chopra said that 23-year-old Prithvi Shaw is a naturally destructive batter. "He (Shaw) is the guy who just takes off," Chopra said. "He is an absolute rocket, he simply flies. I am not saying he will fly in every match. [Jos] Buttler, [Alex] Hales or anyone else is also not seen flying in every match," he added.

258.title: Portugal captain Ronaldo lands in Qatar for FIFA World Cup amid controversy, pics surface
258.article_body: Pictures have surfaced online showing Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo and his team members arriving at Hamad International Airport in Qatar's Doha ahead of FIFA World Cup 2022. Ronaldo has been involved in a controversy at Manchester United after he, in an interview, stated that he is being forced out of the club. As per reports, Manchester United will sue Ronaldo.

259.title: Man who killed partner in MP resort, shared video of body arrested
259.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Police on Friday arrested the man who killed his partner in Jabalpur's Mekhala Resort from Rajasthan's Sirohi district. The accused, resident of Maharashtra, is a history-sheeter named in at least 37 cases in Nasik and Thane districts alone. The accused had posted videos of the victim lying dead in a room with a bedsheet covering her body.

260.title: Fabulous performances throughout: Sharath on Manika's bronze at Asian Cup
260.article_body: Indian table tennis player Sharath Kamal took to Twitter after compatriot Manika Batra became the first-ever Indian woman paddler to win a medal at Asian Cup and wrote, "Fabulous performances throughout. Many congratulations on winning a historical bronze medal." Former Sports Minister Rajyavardhan Rathore tweeted, "Nation is proud of you. Best wishes for your future endeavours."

261.title: Employees union NITES writes to Labour Minister over Amazon layoffs
261.article_body: Nascent Information Technology Employees Senate (NITES) has written a letter to Union Labour Minister Bhupender Yadav alleging that employees at Amazon in India are being forced to quit. As per the letter, Amazon has given a deadline to the employees until November 30 to complete the process. The letter added that Amazon has violated labour laws in the country.

262.title: Karthik was a specialist, he wasn't part of India XI in T20 WC semis: Parthiv
262.article_body: Parthiv Patel said Team India needs to identify their playing XI early in a World Cup year and stick with them till the tournament ends. "Dinesh Karthik was a specialist [in T20 World Cup 2022] and by the time...semi-finals came, he wasn't even part of...playing XI," he added. Karthik scored 14 runs in three innings in T20 World Cup 2022.

263.title: Kerala has become unsafe for women in last 6 years: Union Minister
263.article_body: Union Minister V Muraleedharan claimed that Kerala has become unsafe for women in the last six years of the LDF-led government. "Two women were butchered recently. In Kochi, a woman was kidnapped and gang-raped. Such incidents bring shame to the state," he said. A woman was recently raped by three men in a car after she collapsed at a party.

264.title: Police question owner of Himachal guest house visited by Aftab, Shraddha
264.article_body: A three-member team of Delhi Police on Saturday questioned the owner of a guest house in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district where Shraddha Walkar and Aftab Poonawala stayed in April. Several police teams have reached Uttarakhand and Himachal Pradesh to question owners and staffers of hotels where the couple stayed. Aftab strangled his live-in partner Shraddha on May 18 in Delhi.

265.title: Nepal set for provisional and national elections on Sunday
265.article_body: Nepal will conduct provincial and national elections on Sunday. Over 17.9 million people are eligible to vote. The Federal Parliament has 275 seats, out of which 165 members are elected via direct voting and the rest via the proportional electoral system. The Provincial Assembly has 550 members, of which 330 are elected directly and the rest via the proportional method.

266.title: Ali Fazal to star in Anurag Basu's 'Life in a Metro 2': Reports
266.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Basu is reportedly working on the sequel to his 2007 film 'Life in a Metro'. "It's an ensemble cast film with...mix of familiar and new faces. Ali Fazal is already on board, while...casting of other leads is still in progress," a source was quoted as saying. The film is expected to go on floors in December, reports said.

267.title: Amit Shah to hold rallies in Guj's Tapi, Narmada ahead of Assembly polls
267.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Sunday will hold two public rallies in Gujarat's Tapi and Narmada districts ahead of the Assembly elections. Shah is scheduled to hold meetings in Tapi's Nizar village at 2:30 pm and Narmada's Dediapada town at 4 pm. PM Narendra Modi is scheduled to hold rallies in Gujarat's Saurashtra from November 20 to November 22.

268.title: Man dies by suicide after losing Rae Bareli ZP chairperson election
268.article_body: A man who lost the Zilla Panchayat (ZP) Chairman election in Rae Bareli recently has died by suicide in Lucknow, police said. The deceased man had borrowed money to contest the election. Unable to clear the debt, he was hiding in Lucknow since October 31. The man had contested the election twice in six years and had lost both times.

269.title: Maharashtra govt to form squad for girls who elope: Minister Lodha
269.article_body: Maharashtra's Minister for Skill Development and Entrepreneurship Mangal Prabhat Lodha on Saturday said the government will set up a special squad to protect women who leave their parents' homes after a fight or elope with a partner. The decision comes in the wake of the Shraddha Walker murder case. Shraddha Walker was murdered by her live-in partner Aftab Poonawala.

270.title: 'Swachh Vidyalaya Puraskar' for 2021-22 conferred to 39 schools
270.article_body: The Ministry of Education on Saturday conferred the national-level award under 'Swachh Vidyalaya Puraskar 2021-22' to 39 schools from across the country. The schools selected from among the 8.23 lakh entries include 28 government and aided, while 11 are private schools. "Cash prizes of ₹60,000 to 34 schools (in overall category) and ₹20,000 (in sub-categories) were given," an official said.

271.title: Secularism, idea of India undermined in last 2 years: Chidambaram
271.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram said all pillars of society, including political parties, are "gripped with fear" in the country. "Forces that are undermining the idea of India have been at work in the last 2-2.5 years," the former Union Minister said. He added that "the idea of India has been undermined" and secularism has been reduced to "embracing one religion".

272.title: Election symbols are not a party's exclusive property: Delhi HC
272.article_body: The Delhi High Court has said that political parties cannot consider election symbols as their "exclusive property". "The right to use the symbol can be lost with the dismal performance of the party," said the bench. The observations came while dismissing an appeal by Samata Party against the allotment of the 'flaming torch' symbol to the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena.

273.title: 'Prepared to walk away': EU on likelihood of a 'bad' COP27 deal
273.article_body: The EU warned on Saturday that it is "prepared to walk away" from the COP27 climate summit if negotiators fail to reach a suitable agreement on tackling the climate crisis. "We'd rather have no decision than a bad decision," the bloc's climate action chief Frans Timmermans said. "We believe that a positive result today is still within reach," he added.

274.title: God willing, I will fight next J&K Assembly polls: Farooq Abdullah
274.article_body: Former J&K CM Farooq Abdullah said on Saturday he will "Insha Allah" contest the next Assembly elections in the union territory. "Let them announce the dates, we will show them where they stand," Farooq said, referring to the BJP. Meanwhile, his son Omar Abdullah earlier said Farooq will not participate in the Jammu and Kashmir National Conference's next presidential elections.

275.title: World's most powerful telescope spots 'unusually bright' most distant galaxies
275.article_body: NASA's James Webb Space Telescope- the world's most powerful telescope, has spotted two "exceptionally bright" galaxies with "the most distant starlight that anyone had ever seen". "These two...galaxies could fundamentally alter what we know about the very first stars," said NASA, while releasing images. The galaxies existed approximately 450 and 350 million years after the big bang.

276.title: Honesty was premise of our relationship, that got eroded: Darshan on Akshay
276.article_body: Filmmaker Suneel Darshan, speaking about his equation with Akshay Kumar, said, "Honesty was the premise of my relationship with him, and somewhere, that got eroded." He added that the actor used to treat him like a guru. Suneel, who worked with Akshay in several films, further said he hasn't met the actor since the release of their 2005 film 'Dosti'.

277.title: Two arrested for bomb blast threat at Bharat Jodo Yatra in MP's Indore
277.article_body: Two persons have been arrested for allegedly threatening to blow up Khalsa Stadium in Madhya Pradesh's Indore during Bharat Jodo Yatra on November 28. Earlier this week, a letter threatening the bomb blast had come to light. It stated that Congress MP Rahul Gandhi and the party's state unit chief Kamal Nath would be assassinated at the campaign's Indore halt.

278.title: India's target is to finish on podium of Hockey WC 2023: Midfielder Sumit
278.article_body: Indian men's hockey team midfielder Sumit said his side's target is to finish on the podium of next year's World Cup. "I still remember...2018 World Cup when we lost in the quarter-finals and every time I go back to Bhubaneswar, it reminds me of that loss," he added. World Cup will be played in Bhubaneswar and Rourkela, beginning January 13.

279.title: Centre using CBI, ED, I-T dept as 'Trishul' against non-BJP govts: CPI(M)
279.article_body: CPI(M) leader Brinda Karat on Saturday accused the Centre of using ED, CBI and Income Tax Department as its 'Trishul' (trident) against governments of non-BJP parties in states. She said what Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren is facing is "not a question of one person, but it is an attack on constitutional place of Opposition in a democratic country".

280.title: Reaching T20 WC 2022 semi-finals can be considered an achievement: Ashwin
280.article_body: Team India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin has said that Team India's T20 World Cup 2022 campaign cannot be called "disappointing". He added, "We lost in the semi-finals. Reaching the semi-finals and finals can be considered an achievement. But from an Indian fan's point of view, and the expectations they have of this team, I totally understand the disappointment from the fans."

281.title: K'taka Congress files complaint with SEC over 'voter fraud' by BJP
281.article_body: Congress has filed a complaint with the Karnataka State Election Commission (SEC) against "electoral fraud" in the state, allegedly at the behest of CM Basavaraj Bommai. Congress has alleged that BJP minister CN Ashwath Narayan and his team stole voter data and deleted lakhs of votes. CM Bommai said he has ordered a probe into the matter.

282.title: No country alone can defeat borderless threat of terrorism: Shah
282.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah said the international community must rise above "geo-political interests" against the "borderless threat" of terrorism. "In these terror havens, it's necessary to shackle their unrestrained activities along with economic crackdown," said Shah. Stating that no country can fight the threat alone, he added that some countries have made terrorism their state policy.

283.title: Federal Bank partners with JCB India to provide heavy equipment financing
283.article_body: Federal Bank announced on Friday that it has partnered with JCB India to expand its loan portfolio and fund potential buyers of heavy construction equipment. According to a statement by the lender, the partnership would increase the financing alternatives for JCB consumers in India. Under the arrangement, JCB's customers can avail loans from the lender at competitive interest rates.

284.title: It wasn't dad's decision: Jatin Pandit's son on split with Lalit Pandit
284.article_body: Music composer Jatin Pandit's son Raahul Jatin has said his father never wanted to split with his long-time collaborator and brother Lalit Pandit. "It was never dad's decision and we're still waiting on uncle," he added. Raahul added that Jatin was "really bummed out" after splitting with Lalit. Jatin and Lalit parted ways after working on the 2006 film 'Fanaa'.

285.title: SRK recommended me for Dil Se, Mani said 'can't have 2 similar actresses': Divya
285.article_body: Divya Dutta revealed that Shah Rukh Khan had recommended her name to director Mani Ratnam for his 1998 film 'Dil Se'. She added on his recommendation, Mani messaged her, saying he won't be able to cast her as she looks "similar" to lead actress Manisha Koirala. She recalled the filmmaker saying, "I can't have two similar actresses in one film."

286.title: T'gana Cong expels Shashidhar Reddy for 6 yrs over 'anti-party activities'
286.article_body: Telangana Congress on Saturday expelled senior party leader M Shashidhar Reddy for a period of six years over "anti-party activities". The action against Reddy came after his meeting with Union Home Minister Amit Shah and Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar. Reddy also allegedly passed several comments against TPCC President Revanth Reddy and his style of functioning.

287.title: India planning to showcase Nagaland’s Hornbill Festival at G20
287.article_body: India is planning to showcase Nagaland's Hornbill Festival after it assumes the presidency of G20 on December 1. G20 Chief Coordinator Harsh Vardhan Shringla recently discussed the opportunities to showcase the festival with Nagaland CM Neiphu Rio. "India's G20 is an opportunity for the state of Nagaland to showcase its cultural diversity, uniqueness and tourism potential," Shringla said.

288.title: Russia trying to exhaust Kyiv's air defence supplies: Pentagon official
288.article_body: The recent surge in Russia's missile strikes in Ukraine is partly aimed at exhausting Kyiv's air defence supplies to clear the path for the domination of Ukraine's skies, the Pentagon's top policy advisor has said. "We're committed to making sure...that the Ukrainians get what they need to keep their air defences viable," Colin Kahl told reporters on Saturday.

289.title: Case filed against AMU student who was attacked during cricket match
289.article_body: A countercase has been registered against the Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) student who was allegedly hit on the head during a cricket match. The case has been filed following a report by the accused's father and the insistence of BJP MLC Manvendra Pratap Singh. The victim, Sajid Husain, was hit on the head by fellow second-year student Shobhit Singh.

290.title: Gem, jewellery exports fell 15% to ₹25,844 crore in Oct: Data
290.article_body: The gem and jewellery exports declined 14.64% year-over-year in October at ₹25,843.84 crore as against ₹30,274.64 crore from the year-ago period, the Gem and Jewellery Export Promotion Council (GJEPC) said. The decline in exports in October or November is a seasonal trend as manufacturing activities are either limited or units are closed because of Diwali, GJEPC stated.

291.title: Playing T10 league has helped improve my game against spin: Hales
291.article_body: England batter Alex Hales said that playing Abu Dhabi T10 has definitely helped him in improving his batting against spin bowling. "It's still an area (spin) that I'm looking to get better at, so I'll be sure to...top up as much as I can," Hales said. He added that he is pretty familiar with what to expect in UAE conditions.

292.title: Haryana village gifts SUV, ₹2 crore to defeated Sarpanch candidate
292.article_body: To avoid bitterness, residents of Chiri village in Haryana gifted an SUV car and ₹2.11 crore to a candidate who lost the Sarpanch elections on November 12. Dharmpal Dalal alias Kala, who was overwhelmed by the gesture, said, "I'll contribute to the village welfare activities like before after today's gesture." He lost the elections to Naveen Dalal by 66 votes.

293.title: 2 injured as autorickshaw explodes in Mangaluru, police say 'remain calm'
293.article_body: An autorickshaw driver and a passenger sustained injuries after the vehicle exploded in Karnataka's Mangaluru on Saturday. "They are undergoing treatment and are unable to speak now. We request the public not to spread rumours. They should remain calm and not panic," Mangaluru City Police Commissioner N Shashi Kumar said. "The driver alleged he spotted the fire," he added.

294.title: 'Can't take Indian photos due to lighting' sign at Australian post office sparks row
294.article_body: A sign that said "Due to our lighting and quality of photo background, we, unfortunately, CAN NOT take INDIAN photos" was seen at a post office in Adelaide city of South Australia, sparking criticism. A picture of the sign was posted on Twitter, following which Australia Post said, "We're sincerely sorry for the offence caused by this unauthorised sign."

295.title: Activist Navlakha released from jail, to be put under house arrest
295.article_body: Activist Gautam Navlakha, accused in the Elgar Parishad-Maoist link case, was released from Taloja jail and handed over to Navi Mumbai Police for house arrest on Saturday. This comes after the Supreme Court on Thursday allowed Navlakha to be shifted to house arrest for a month. Navlakha had approached the SC saying that he was suffering from health issues.

296.title: Centre to spend ₹50,000 cr on infrastructural development of Arunachal: PM
296.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday said the Centre is going to spend ₹50,000 crore in near future for the infrastructural development of Arunachal Pradesh. PM Modi, who inaugurated the Donyi Polo Airport at Hollongi, said that the state has great potential for tourism. With the development of the new airport, farmers can sell their produce to bigger markets, he added.

297.title: 8, including 3 women, injured in ordnance factory explosion in TN
297.article_body: Eight persons, including three women, were injured in an explosion at an ordnance factory near Coonoor in Tamil Nadu's Nilgiris on Saturday, an official said. The explosion occurred at 8:20 am in the cordite section, the factory's Deputy General Manager T Sanker said. Since workers weren't present in the section during the explosion, there were no grievous injuries, he added.

298.title: Air India in talks with Airbus, Boeing for 'historic order': CEO Wilson
298.article_body: Tata Group-owned Air India is in talks with Boeing and Airbus about ordering new aircraft, the airline's CEO Campbell Wilson said. "We're in deep discussion with Boeing, Airbus...for a historic order of the latest generation aircraft that will power Air India's medium- and long-term growth," he added. In September, Air India said it would lease 30 Boeing and Airbus planes.

299.title: Loco pilot, his assistant run over by Howrah-Mumbai Mail in J'khand
299.article_body: A loco pilot and his assistant were killed after they were run over by Howrah-Mumbai Mail in Jharkhand, a Railways official said on Saturday. The incident took place when the duo, posted at Chakradharpur, was changing the engine of a goods train. The passenger train was going through an adjacent line, the official added.

300.title: Rohit, Rahul, Kohli are on wrong side of 30s: Aakash on top 3 in T20Is
300.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Aakash Chopra said some adjustments need to be made in India's top three in T20Is considering the next T20 World Cup in 2024. He added that Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul and Virat Kohli are on the wrong side of thirties. While Rohit and Kohli are 35 and 34 years old respectively, Rahul turned 30 in April this year.

301.title: Tesla recalls 3,21,000 vehicles in US over rear light issue
301.article_body: Tesla is recalling more than 3,21,000 vehicles in US because one or both tail lights may intermittently fail to illuminate, according to a filing with US National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. The Texas-based EV maker said the recall affects some 2023 Model 3 and 2020-2023 Model Y vehicles. Tesla will deploy an over-the-air update to correct the issue.

302.title: Shivaji an old idol, find new ones like Nitin Gadkari: Maha Governor
302.article_body: Maharashtra Governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari faced criticism from Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena on Saturday for calling Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj an 'old idol'. "You can find new (idols), from Babasaheb Ambedkar to Nitin Gadkari," he said. "Shivaji...is not only our deity but our source of inspiration. He will always be the idol for...us," a spokesman from Uddhav's Shiv Sena said.

303.title: UP Police cancels leaves of all its personnel in view of polls
303.article_body: UP Police has cancelled the leaves of all of its personnel in view of the upcoming parliamentary and Assembly by-polls, and local body elections. A directive issued in this regard on Saturday said the leaves had been cancelled with immediate effect till the completion of the election process. Concerned officers, however, have been authorised to grant leaves in special cases.

304.title: Women can fulfil dreams post marriage: BJP Guj candidate Rivaba Jadeja
304.article_body: Cricketer Ravindra Jadeja's wife Rivaba, who's a BJP candidate in Gujarat Assembly elections, said on Saturday, "I want to inspire couples that women can fulfil their dreams after marriage." Praising Ravindra for supporting her, she said, "My husband is like a booster dose for me." Rivaba added, "It's...important that behind the success of every woman, there's her husband and brother."

305.title: Radisson Blu Ghaziabad owner Amit Jain found dead at Delhi flat
305.article_body: Amit Jain, the owner of Radisson Blu hotel in UP's Ghaziabad has been found dead, reports said on Saturday. Jain's body was found hanging at his residential flat in Delhi's Khel Gaon and suicide is suspected, police said. His body has reportedly been sent for post-mortem. As per reports, Jain was distressed due to business losses.

306.title: Retired IAS officer Arun Goel appointed Election Commissioner
306.article_body: Retired bureaucrat Arun Goel was on Saturday appointed Election Commissioner in the Election Commission of India (ECI), the Law and Justice Ministry said. The 1985 batch ex-IAS officer was appointed to the post of the third Election Commissioner. The post was vacant after the then-Election Commissioner Rajiv Kumar took the charge as the Chief Election Commissioner in May this year.

307.title: Uddhav must dump Cong over Rahul's remarks against Savarkar: BJP leader
307.article_body: BJP leader Raosaheb Patil Danve on Saturday said Shiv Sena chief Uddhav Thackeray must break his party's alliance with Congress over Rahul Gandhi's remarks on VD Savarkar. "Balasaheb Thackeray spread the message of Swatantryaveer Savarkar across Maharashtra, and now his son and grandson are sitting with a party that insults...[him]," Danve said, adding Rahul Gandhi has no knowledge of history.

308.title: Savarkar apologised to British to move out of jail: Tushar Gandhi
308.article_body: Freedom Fighter Mahatma Gandhi's great-grandson Tushar Gandhi commented after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi accused VD Savarkar of writing mercy petitions to the British. "It is true that Savarkar was friendly with the British, he apologised to the British just to move out of prison, and it is not...taken from WhatsApp University, there is evidence in history," Tushar said.

309.title: Video shows cow roaming inside MP govt hospital, 3 staffers fired
309.article_body: A video showing a cow roaming in the ICU ward of a district hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Rajgarh has surfaced online. The incident reportedly took place on Friday, following which three staff members and a security guard were expelled. As per reports, the cow entered the building, although cow catchers are deployed at the hospital to prevent such mishaps.

310.title: Video shows students made to climb roof to fill water tank in UP school
310.article_body: A video showing two students filling a water tank on the school's roof in Uttar Pradesh's Amethi has surfaced on social media. The video shows a man handing over a bucket to a student standing on the roof. He then passes the bucket to another student who fills the water tank. The school is reported to be Islampur Primary School.

311.title: Funny: Suniel Shetty on Mehul Choksi alleging 'File No 323' defames him
311.article_body: Reacting to Mehul Choksi sending legal notice to makers of 'File No 323' for allegedly making an attempt to defame him, actor Suniel Shetty said, "I don't know where that has come from." He added, "Whole thing of him being defamed is funny." He further stated the director and producers are making something from whatever is available in public domain.

312.title: I sucked, it's a disaster: Medvedev on failing to close out match vs Djokovic
312.article_body: Following the loss after failing to serve out his final round-robin match against Novak Djokovic in ATP Finals, Daniil Medvedev said, "I sucked, so that's what happened. It's a disaster." Medvedev remained winless and finished last in Red Group. "I'm going to try to be better next time," the 2020 champion added. Medvedev lost 3-6, 7-6(7-5), 6-7(2-7).

313.title: Neha Kakkar & I were rejected from Indian Idol on same day: Ayushmann
313.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana, in an episode of 'Indian Idol 13', revealed that he and Neha Kakkar had once auditioned for the show and got rejected on the same day. "We were returning...to Delhi on...same train, we were about fifty people who got rejected together. Today she's the judge here and I'm on her show, it...really means a lot," he added.

314.title: Jaguar Land Rover opens 800 roles to hire fired Meta, Twitter workers
314.article_body: Tata Motors-owned luxury carmaker Jaguar Land Rover said it's looking to recruit tech workers who were recently laid off by companies like Meta, Twitter and Amazon. The company announced a job portal to fill 800 roles in areas like self-driving, electrification, machine learning and data science. The recruitment will be conducted in UK, Ireland, US, India, China and Hungary.

315.title: 4 arrested in Bengaluru for trying to sell items made of elephant ivory
315.article_body: Bengaluru Police arrested four people for allegedly trying to sell items made out of elephant ivory. The police recovered ivory material of around 7.5 kilograms from the accused. "A bracelet, boxes, door handles, irregular artwork, a knife made of deer, amber containing a scorpion, walking sticks, elephant idols and other valuables were seized from the accused," police said.

316.title: Delhi recorded coldest morning of the season today with 9°C min temperature
316.article_body: Delhi on Saturday recorded its coldest morning of this season with the minimum temperature falling to 9°C, said the India Meteorological Department. On the day, the maximum temperature was expected to be 26°C. Relative humidity was 83% at 8.30 am. On Friday, the minimum temperature in Delhi was 9.6°C and the maximum temperature was 25.9°C.

317.title: 3 school children drown after entering village tank to play in Hyd
317.article_body: Three school children drowned in a village tank in Hyderabad's Nanakramguda on Saturday. "The children didn't know how to swim and entered the tank to play," Gachibowli SHO G Suresh said. The deceased have been identified as 15-year-old Shahbaz, 12-year-old Deepak and 13-year-old Pavan. They were residents of Telecom Nagar, Gachibowli.

318.title: Satyendar Jain moves court against ED over leaked massage video
318.article_body: Delhi minister Satyendar Jain's legal team on Saturday moved a special court with an application seeking contempt action against Enforcement Directorate (ED) over a leaked CCTV video showing the AAP leader getting a massage. "The court will hear on Monday how did BJP get the confidential footage and why it was circulated," Jain's lawyer Mohd Irshad tweeted.

319.title: My team said 'What's wrong with you?': Madhur on casting Prateik in 'India...'
319.article_body: Filmmaker Madhur Bhandarkar opened up about how his team wasn't sure about getting Prateik Babbar on board for the role of a migrant worker in the upcoming film 'India Lockdown'. "They all said, 'Sir, what's wrong with you? Why would Prateik play...migrant worker? This isn't...elite role'," he said, adding, "I said, 'I'll put him into work. Leave it to me'."

320.title: AIIMS Delhi to start smart card payment facility from April 2023
320.article_body: The All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) in Delhi is set to start an "AIIMS Smart Card facility" for making payments from April 1 next year. The facility aims to make the payment procedure easier for patients and help them avoid queues. The AIIMS' finance division is collaborating with the State Bank of India to start this facility.

321.title: Timing of beer ban at FIFA WC is unfortunate: German team director
321.article_body: Germany team director Oliver Bierhoff said that the timing of the beer ban at the stadiums during the FIFA World Cup in Qatar is unfortunate. "Such a short-notice decision (on beer)...creates unease...This (beer) is a part of the tournament but I cannot really understand...because there was enough time to take such a decision earlier," Bierhoff said.

322.title: Yerawada Jail havaldar, canteen staffer arrested for seeking bribe
322.article_body: A havaldar and a canteen staffer of the Yerawada Jail in Pune have been arrested for allegedly demanding a bribe from a convict who is presently out on parole. The Anti-Corruption Bureau identified the arrested as Havaldar Bajirao Patil (54) and canteen staffer Rihana Asif Sayyad (48). The complainant alleged that Patil had demanded a bribe of ₹50,000.

323.title: Alibag woman cheated of ₹1.12 crore by online 'friend from England'
323.article_body: A case has been registered against unknown persons for cheating a retired court superintendent based in Alibag, near Mumbai, of ₹1.12 crore. She befriended a man on social media who claimed to be from England and said he had sent her gifts, for which she needed to pay customs duty. Once the money was transferred, the accused stopped all communication.

324.title: Over 400 Ukrainian children killed since Russian invasion: Kyiv
324.article_body: At least 437 Ukrainian children have been killed and more than 837 have been injured so far as a result of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the Ukrainian Prosecutor General's office said on Saturday. Officials said the figures were "not final" as they were still verifying information from zones of active fighting, liberated areas and Russian-occupied territories.

325.title: PCMC to set up ICUs using ventilators received during COVID-19 outbreak
325.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) is planning to set up more intensive care units (ICUs) in its hospitals by using around 300 ventilators that it received during the COVID-19 outbreak. These 300 ventilators are presently unused and stored in the civic body's hospital in Masulkar Colony. PCMC got the ventilators from the government and through donations and CSR funds.

326.title: Traffic advisory issued in Delhi due to religious procession on Sunday
326.article_body: Delhi Police has issued a traffic advisory for 'Feast of the Christ the King' procession that will begin from St Columba's School at 10:30 am and conclude at 12:00 pm on Sunday. The procession will cover Gol Dak Khana, Baba Kharak Singh Marg, Connaught Place, Gol Market etc. Police have urged citizens to plan their commute accordingly.

327.title: CBI files chargesheet against ex-ABG Shipyard chief, 24 others in ₹23,000-cr bank fraud case
327.article_body: The CBI today filed a chargesheet against ex-ABG Shipyard Chairman Rishi Kamlesh Agarwal and 24 others in a ₹23,000-crore bank fraud case. In September, the CBI had arrested Rishi in connection with the case. The ABG Shipyard had created a web of transactions to cheat a consortium of 28 banks to the tune of ₹22,842 crore between 2012 and 2017.

328.title: I don't want to reveal: Novak on mid-match trembles vs Medvedev in ATP Finals
328.article_body: Following his three-hour 11-minute win against Daniil Medvedev in Red Group at ATP Finals in Turin, Novak Djokovic, who was seen gasping for breath and shaking mid-match, said, "I don't want to reveal what I'm going through exactly to my opponents." Djokovic finished the round-robin stage with a 3-0 record after defeating Medvedev 6-3, 6-7(5-7), 7-6(7-2) on Friday.

329.title: Co-prisoners gave massage to Satyendar Jain, it's not allowed: Ex-Tihar PRO
329.article_body: Sunil Gupta, ex-PRO of Tihar jail, said the video of Delhi minister Satyendar Jain receiving massage in jail clearly shows that co-prisoners were giving him massage. "The massage that he was being given inside the cell is not permissible under jail rules," Gupta added. He stressed that inmates can be given physiotherapy in physiotherapy centres by physiotherapists or trained experts.

330.title: Man kills 6-year-old son after fight with wife in Mumbai, detained
330.article_body: A man has been arrested for killing his 6-year-old son after an alleged fight with his wife in Mumbai's Malad. The woman found her son's body on the floor when she returned after dropping their daughter at school. During interrogation, police found that the couple used to fight over minor disputes, the details of which are yet to be revealed.

331.title: Zomato confirms laying off under 3% staff nationwide
331.article_body: Online food delivery service Zomato on Saturday confirmed that it will lay off under 3% of its staff nationwide. The company stated that the laying offs are based on regular performance. "There has been a regular performance-based churn of under 3 per cent of our workforce, there's nothing more to it," a Zomato spokesperson said.

332.title: Hijab protesters set fire to home of Iran's Islamic regime's founder, video surfaces
332.article_body: Anti-hijab protesters in Iran set fire to the old home of former supreme leader Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini who founded the current Islamic Republic of Iran. The home-turned-museum of Khomeini was reportedly set ablaze using petrol bombs with videos of the arson surfacing online. The protests that began with 22-year-old Mahsa Amini's death in police custody have entered their third month.

333.title: Actress Tabassum passes away due to cardiac arrest
333.article_body: Veteran actress Tabassum passed away after suffering a cardiac arrest on Friday night. "She was absolutely healthy...It happened all of a sudden," her son Hoshang Govil said. Tabassum started her career as a child actor in 1947. She also hosted popular Doordarshan celebrity talk show 'Phool Khile Hain Gulshan Gulshan' from 1972 to 1993.

334.title: Manika creates history: Rijiju on TT player's bronze medal win at Asian Cup
334.article_body: After Manika Batra won a bronze medal at Asian Cup, Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju tweeted, "Manika Batra creates history by becoming the first-ever Indian female paddler to win a medal at the prestigious Asian Cup." He added, "She defeated world number six and three-time Asian champion Hina Hayata!! Congratulations." The 27-year-old won the bronze medal match 4-2.

335.title: SC judge recuses from hearing pleas against ED chief's tenure extension
335.article_body: SC judge Justice SK Kaul on Friday recused himself from hearing the petitions challenging the tenure extension granted to ED chief Sanjay Kumar Mishra last year. Justice Kaul said that the matter would be listed before a bench of which he is not a part. The Centre on Thursday granted a third one-year tenure extension to Mishra as ED chief.

336.title: I've chat, recordings of your gang of thugs: Conman Sukesh warns Kejriwal
336.article_body: In a letter against AAP from prison, conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar accused Satyendar Jain of seeking help to convert $20 million into Indian rupees and bitcoin in 2017 and said he has evidence to back his claims. "I've each and every chat and recordings of your gang of "thugs"," he said. He also asked Kejriwal to agree to a polygraph test.

337.title: Cyberabad Police launch 'My Transport is Safe' app to ensure easy travel
337.article_body:
Cyberabad Police on Friday launched 'My Transport is Safe' application to ensure safe and easy travel. Through the application, unique QR code stickers have been given to vehicles with special permission during no-entry times, considering traffic congestion and public safety. 
"All...details related to the vehicle like validity, route and other...details are included in the QR code," police said.

338.title: World economy could lose $1.4 tn if divided into 2 blocs: IMF chief
338.article_body: International Monetary Fund (IMF) Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva said Ukraine-Russia conflict and increase in trade restrictions against China and other countries could cost the global economy $1.4 trillion. "The world is going to lose 1.5% of GDP just because of division that may split us into two trading blocs," Georgieva said. "The sooner the war ends, the better," she added.

339.title: BR Ambedkar was probably India's first male feminist: Shashi Tharoor
339.article_body: BR Ambedkar was probably India's first male feminist, said writer and Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Saturday. He added that between 1920s-1940s, Ambedkar made speeches, including in front of a female audience, which today would be considered as progressive for male politicians. Tharoor further said that Ambedkar urged women to delay marriage and stand up to their husbands as equals.

340.title: Telangana govt encourages farmers for oil palm cultivation: KTR
340.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao said the state government was initiating steps to encourage farmers to cultivate oil palm and oil seed in the days to come. Efforts are being made to convert 20 lakh-acre of paddy fields into oil palm in five years, he said. This way, the government can reduce import dependence on edible oils, he added.

341.title: Dalai Lama honoured with Gandhi Mandela Award in Himachal
341.article_body: Tibetan spiritual leader the Dalai Lama on Saturday was honoured with the Gandhi Mandela Award by the Gandhi Mandela Foundation at the Tsuglagkhang Temple in Dharamshala, Himachal Pradesh. While accepting the award, the leader said, "Any problem cannot be solved by war, but through dialogue and peace." He received the medal from Himachal Pradesh Governor Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar.

342.title: Private firm owner, aide held for ₹20.96 cr GST fraud in Navi Mumbai
342.article_body: The Central Goods and Services Tax (CGST) officials in Navi Mumbai arrested a company owner and his aide for allegedly passing on fake input tax credit of ₹20.96 crore, an official said. The officials arrested the proprietor of two companies "Storage Miles and Catbus" and his accomplice. Firms allegedly utilised input tax credit of ₹10.48 crore received from fake entities.

343.title: Couple invites Indian Army to their wedding in Kerala, Army replies
343.article_body: A Kerala couple while inviting the Indian Army for their wedding on 10th November, said, "We owe a deep debt of gratitude to you for keeping us safe." They added, "Thank you for giving us happy days with our loved ones." Indian Army shared the note on Instagram, saying, "Army...wishes the couple a very happy & blissful wedded life."

344.title: How does 2022 FIFA World Cup's prize money compare with that of cricket World Cups?
344.article_body: The winners of 2022 FIFA World Cup will receive a prize money of $42 million, while the runners-up will get $30 million. England, the winners of T20 World Cup 2022, received $1.6 million, while Pakistan, who were the runners-up, took home $800,000. England, the winners of the 10-team 2019 ODI World Cup, received $4 million in prize money.

345.title: Today I feel gay, I feel disabled, I feel like migrant worker: FIFA Prez ahead of Qatar WC
345.article_body: During his speech on 2022 FIFA World Cup eve, FIFA President Gianni Infantino said, "Today I feel Qatari. Today I feel Arabic. Today I feel African. Today I feel gay. Today I feel disabled. Today I feel (like) a migrant worker." Responding to treatment of LGBTQ people in Qatar, Infantino said that more open laws were "part of a process".

346.title: Drugs worth over ₹61 crore seized by EC since November 3 in Gujarat
346.article_body: The surveillance teams of the Election Commission and the Gujarat Police have seized 817 kg of drugs worth over ₹61 crore since the notification of the Gujarat Assembly elections was issued on November 3. The state Chief Electoral Officer claimed that 51 illegal weapons and 274 illegal ammunition have also been confiscated till now.

347.title: Shehnaaz scolds bodyguard as he pushes fan, tells him 'I want to take pics'
347.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill, who was in Dubai for an event, scolded a bodyguard when he allegedly pushed a fan who was trying to take a picture with her. In a video that surfaced online, she can be seen telling the bodyguard that she wants to take pictures with the fans. "What happened?" she can be seen asking the bodyguard.

348.title: Aamir dances to 'Papa Kehte...' at daughter's engagement party, video surfaces
348.article_body: A video showing Aamir Khan dancing to 'Papa Kehte Hain' at his daughter Ira Khan's engagement party on Friday has surfaced. In the video shared by Bollywood photographer Viral Bhayani, Ira could be seen cheering for Aamir and his cousin Mansoor Khan as they grooved to the song. 'Papa Kehte Hain' was a part of Aamir's 'Qayamat Se Qayamat Tak'.

349.title: India's T20 WC 2007 triumph set to be turned into web series: Report
349.article_body: India's 2007 T20 World Cup-winning campaign is reportedly set to be turned into a web series. "A multi-language documentary web series on the 2007 T20 Cricket World Cup...is officially announced...It is set to release in 2023," film critic Taran Adarsh tweeted. Notably, the series is being directed by Anand Kumar and is produced by UK-based 'One One Six Network'.

350.title: Twinkle had issues with Priyanka: Suneel recalls Akshay opting out of 'Barsaat'
