350.article_body: Filmmaker Suneel Darshan opened up about why Akshay Kumar dropped out of his production 'Barsaat'. He said Akshay told him that he was having some issues with his dates. "By then, I had also got to know of...other issues that had come up between him and his wife. She (Twinkle Khanna) had issues with Priyanka, I was told," Suneel said.

351.title: Over 83,000 Russian soldiers killed by our forces so far: Ukraine
351.article_body: Ukraine on Saturday claimed that its forces have killed around 83,880 Russian soldiers since the Russian invasion began on February 24. Around 2,885 Russian tanks and over 535 aircraft, including 261 helicopters, have also been destroyed, Ukraine's Foreign Ministry said. It further estimated that its troops have destroyed 5,815 armoured personnel carriers and 393 multiple launch rocket systems.

352.title: Mumbai's British-era Carnac bridge to be cut into 44 pieces
352.article_body: Mumbai's British-era Carnac bridge which is to be demolished on Saturday and Sunday will be cut into 44 pieces in a 27-hour operation. "They'll be cut with the help of 50 gas cutters...and...about 300 gas cylinders will be utilized," a Central Railway official said. "Total manpower of 400 plus...will be used to carry out the operation smoothly," he added.

353.title: Kejriwal swindled money meant for children's education: Sukesh in new letter
353.article_body: Conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar has accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of misappropriating money meant for children's education. "You want to make money in the name of Delhi School Model...Satyendar Ji, Manish Ji only matter is greed for money," Sukesh wrote in his seventh letter against AAP from jail. Earlier, Sukesh had alleged he arranged the PR for AAP's Delhi schools' story.

354.title: List of most polluted Indian cities today released
354.article_body: The Central Pollution Control Board released the city-wise air quality index (AQI) on Saturday, with Bihar's Darbhanga and Motihari having the highest AQI at 394 and 377, respectively. This is followed by Siwan (366), Bettiah (362), Katihar (358), Chapra (330), Saharsa (315), Samastipur (309) and Muzaffarpur (303). All the cities fall under 'very poor' category of air quality.

355.title: Educated women have double standards, women are their own enemies: Jaya
355.article_body: Actress Jaya Bachchan said that educated women also have double standards. "[It] is so sad. I want to say it sometimes but do not feel good about saying it, but women are their own enemies," she added. Jaya also said that raising up the kids is not just a mother's, but also the father's responsibility.

356.title: 'Brought through proper channel': Man accused of abducting son from Ukraine
356.article_body: A man who has been accused by his Ukrainian ex-wife of kidnapping their three-year-old son has claimed before the Delhi HC that his son is an Indian citizen. While replying to his ex-wife's petition, the man argued that an "Indian citizen cannot be sent to a war zone". He stated that his son was brought to India "through proper channels".

357.title: India to add $1 trillion to GDP every 12-18 months within next decade: Adani
357.article_body: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani on Saturday said India will start adding a trillion dollar to its gross domestic product (GDP) every 12-18 months within the next decade. "It took us 58 years to get to our first trillion dollars of GDP, 12 years to get to the next trillion and just five years for the third trillion," Adani said.

358.title: FTX launches strategic review of assets, seeks court relief to pay vendors
358.article_body: Collapsed crypto exchange FTX said that it is launching a strategic review of its global assets as a part of the bankruptcy process. FTX sought court relief to allow the operation of a new global cash management system and payment to its critical vendors. FTX said the failure to receive the relief will result in "immediate and irreparable harm".

359.title: Rahul Gandhi met 'anti-national pastors' during padyatra: Tejasvi Surya
359.article_body: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya criticised Congress MP Rahul Gandhi over his remarks against VD Savarkar and accused him of involving 'anti-national pastors' in the Bharat Jodo Yatra. "It appears that it is more like a 'Bharat Todo Andolan' by uniting anti-nationals on a single platform. Former PM late Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru also targeted Veer Savarkar several times," said Surya.

360.title: 5 killed as car falls into gorge in U'khand, 2nd accident in 2 days
360.article_body: Five persons were killed and one was seriously injured when the car in which they were travelling fell into a gorge in the Uttarkashi district of Uttarakhand on Saturday around 11 am. The woman who was injured is critical. A day earlier, 12 persons were killed when a pick-up vehicle fell into a gorge in the Chamoli district.

361.title: Labourer contesting Guj polls pays ₹10,000 deposit in ₹1 coins
361.article_body: Mahendra Patni, a daily wage worker who is contesting as an independent candidate from Gujarat's Gandhinagar North seat, submitted ₹10,000 deposit in ₹1 coins. He carried the coins in two sacks and said he spent three days collecting them. He said his and 520 other huts were demolished to build a 5-star-hotel and revamp the Gandhinagar railway station.

362.title: It's getting 1 million votes/hour: Musk on poll to reinstate Trump on Twitter
362.article_body: After starting a Twitter poll asking users whether former US President Donald Trump should be reinstated on the platform, Twitter CEO Elon Musk gave an update saying, "Trump poll getting ~1M votes/hour!" Twitter permanently suspended Trump after the US Capitol riots in January 2021. Earlier, Musk tweeted saying the voice of the people is the voice of God.

363.title: Pak intruder killed as Army foils infiltration bid in J&K's Rajouri
363.article_body: The Indian Army foiled an infiltration bid by suspected terrorists along the LOC in the Rajouri district of Jammu & Kashmir, an official said on Saturday. A Pakistani intruder was killed while trying to negotiate a minefield during the failed infiltration attempt, as per officials cited by ANI. The incident took place in the Naushera sector, as per news reports.

364.title: NMMC starts special survey in Navi Mumbai to check measles cases
364.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) has started a special survey wherein health workers will visit each household to find out if there are any suspected cases of measles. They will also check if babies up to five years have been vaccinated or not. The survey will be completed by November 30. The city is currently reeling under measles outbreak.

365.title: Man cheated of over ₹40 lakh on pretext of marriage in Karnataka
365.article_body: A man was allegedly cheated of over ₹40 lakh by a woman on the pretext of marriage in the Vijayapura district of Karnataka. According to the police, the accused sent him a friend request on Facebook and started chatting with him. The accused claimed that she has become an IAS officer and made him transfer the money through multiple transactions.

366.title: Men cheat 620 people of ₹15 cr on pretext of offering jobs, held in Hyd
366.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Thursday arrested four men for cheating around 620 people on the pretext of offering them jobs. The prime accused has been identified as Deepak Sharma, CEO of a Ghaziabad-based company. The accused offered a work-from-home job to digitise/scan old books. They collected a total of about ₹15 crore from the victims in the name of caution deposit.

367.title: Van driver arrested for molesting 9-year-old schoolgirl in Mumbai
367.article_body: A 25-year-old van driver was arrested for allegedly molesting a 9-year-old schoolgirl in Mumbai. The incident happened when the accused, Suresh Bhalerao, was dropping the girl at her home in Mulund from her school. The girl told her mother that Bhalerao touched her inappropriately and allegedly threatened her not to tell anyone about the incident, police said.

368.title: Speeding truck runs over vegetable vendor on Kharar-Kurali Highway, probe on
368.article_body: A 35-year-old vegetable vendor was killed after a speeding truck ran over him on the Kharar-Kurali Highway. The incident took place at around 6:20 pm on Friday. "The truck driver fled after the incident. We are trying to identify him," Kharar Station House Officer, Inspector Yogesh Kumar said. Reports said that the vendor had attached his stall to a motorcycle.

369.title: We have world's oldest language Tamil: PM at Kashi Tamil Sangamam
369.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday hailed Tamil as the world's oldest language at the Kashi Tamil Sangamam event in Varanasi. "We have the world's oldest language. It is still alive and popular as ever," said PM Modi. "People around the world are amazed when they know India is home to the oldest language of the world," he added.

370.title: You will survive: FIFA chief as fans criticise Qatar World Cup alcohol ban
370.article_body: FIFA President Gianni Infantino has reacted to criticism from World Cup fans over a ban on alcohol sales around stadiums. "I think personally if for three hours a day you cannot drink a beer, you will survive," said Infantino. Alcohol will be available at FIFA fan festivals, other fan destinations, and licensed venues.

371.title: CCTV video shows Aftab with bag at 4am on Oct 18, police suspect he has body parts
371.article_body: Aftab Ameen Poonawala, who has been accused of killing his live-in girlfriend Shraddha Walkar in Delhi, was purportedly seen walking with a bag outside his home in a CCTV footage recorded on October 18 at around 4 am. Police suspect that he's going to throw Shraddha's chopped body parts. He allegedly killed Shraddha on May 18.

372.title: Madras HC grants conditional bail to YouTuber Savukku Shankar
372.article_body: The Madras High Court on Friday granted conditional bail to YouTuber Savukku Shankar. This comes after the Supreme Court last week suspended the six-month imprisonment sentence awarded to him by the HC for contempt of court. The high court ordered Shankar not to make any comments on social media or indulge in any activities offending the judiciary.

373.title: Taiwan announces death of giant panda gifted by China in 2008
373.article_body: A giant male panda gifted by China to Taiwan in 2008 died on Saturday after suffering a spate of seizures, Taipei Zoo said. Tuan Tuan and his mate, Yuan Yuan, were gifted when relations between the two were more cordial. China claims democratically-governed Taiwan as its own territory and has vowed to take the island by force if necessary.

374.title: Being promoted as captain of PBKS is motivation for him: Kaif on Dhawan
374.article_body: Sharing his views on PBKS' decision to appoint Shikhar Dhawan as captain for IPL 2023, Mohammad Kaif said, "It's good that he has been given that responsibility and respect." He added, "Being promoted as captain of Punjab will be a motivation for Dhawan at this stage in his career."  The 36-year-old replaced Mayank Agarwal as captain.

375.title: Hyd man kills 2 puppies, films act and posts videos on social media; held
375.article_body: Police have arrested a Hyderabad man for allegedly killing two puppies and uploading videos on social media after filming the incidents. The incidents came to light when he uploaded the videos on Instagram from an ID identified as Ray. A complaint regarding the same was filed on November 18. The complaint alleged that the accused was a drug addict.

376.title: San Francisco to host APEC summit in 2023: US VP Kamala Harris
376.article_body: US' San Francisco city will host the leaders' meeting of the Asia-Pacific Economic Cooperation (APEC) forum next year, US Vice President Kamala Harris said. "Our host year will demonstrate the enduring economic commitment of the US to the Indo-Pacific," Harris, who's leading the US delegation at this year's summit in Bangkok, added. The summit will take place in November, 2023.

377.title: Yatra Online gets SEBI's approval to float IPO
377.article_body: Yatra Online Inc's Indian subsidiary Yatra Online Limited has received SEBI's approval to float an IPO. The IPO will comprise a fresh issue of equity shares worth nearly ₹750 crore by Yatra India and an offer-for-sale of up to 93,28,358 equity shares. THCL Travel Holding Cyprus Limited and Pandara Trust Scheme I through its trustee Vistra ITCL would offload shares.

378.title: Mumbai businessman cheated of ₹30 lakh in loan fraud, case filed
378.article_body: A Mumbai-based businessman, Pritesh Kumar Shaha, was allegedly cheated of ₹30 lakh by two persons on the pretext of helping him secure a loan. Shaha, who runs a steel trading firm, needed a loan to expand his business. Shaha met the accused in 2017, who demanded ₹1 crore to start the loan process, but Shaha paid ₹30 lakh, police said.

379.title: Bengaluru will be India's 'economic capital' in 5 years: Basavaraj Bommai
379.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai asserted that Bengaluru will be India’s 'economic capital' in the next five years. "Karnataka has always been in the top position in attracting foreign investments and startups. The investors and entrepreneurs are now eyeing places around Bengaluru. The state also maintains a good ranking in the fields of agriculture, technology and economy," said Bommai.

380.title: Wedding reception of interfaith couple allegedly cancelled after protests in Mumbai
380.article_body: The wedding reception of an interfaith couple was allegedly cancelled in Mumbai's Vasai after protests by a group. The hall owner reportedly refused to allow the reception after receiving multiple calls. According to the police, neither the couple nor the hall owner has filed any complaint. 'If we receive a complaint, we will take appropriate action," the police added.

381.title: NGT orders realtor to pay ₹10 cr for illegally cutting 500 trees in Faridabad
381.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has ordered a Hyderabad-based real estate developer to pay a compensation of ₹10 crore for illegally felling over 500 trees on five acres of protected forest land in Faridabad. Besides the compensation and the liability to restore the forest land, the company will also be required to do afforestation to the extent of ten times.

382.title: GHMC Mayor launches mobile labs to run quality checks on food
382.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) along with Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI) launched mobile labs called 'Food Safety on Wheels' to run quality checks on food. One such unit was launched by Hyderabad Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal. "Four food safety officers and one laboratory technician will be in the vehicle...to check the quality of food," Gadwal said.

383.title: If Anupamaa is on-air, my son covers his face & leaves: Rupali
383.article_body: Actress Rupali Ganguly said in an interview that her son Rudransh does not watch her show 'Anupamaa'. "He enters a room, if Anupamaa is on-air, he covers his face and leaves," she added. "Initially, [he] thought...Anupamaa is my second family and that's why his mumma doesn't spend time with him a lot...I think he misses our time together," said Rupali.

384.title: TDP chief loses cool, calls protesters 'rascals, unworthy people'
384.article_body: During a rally in Andhra Pradesh's Kurnool, TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu lost his cool and hurled abuses at protesters, calling them "dumb rascals", "unworthy people" and "heinous criminals". A video of the incident has surfaced in which he was also heard asking his supporters to "catch that thief and bring him to me".

385.title: Who are the notable absentees from 2022 FIFA World Cup?
385.article_body: Among notable absentees from 2022 FIFA World Cup is Norwegian striker Erling Haaland, the highest goal-scorer in the ongoing Premier League season. Mohamed Salah will also miss the tournament as Egypt failed to qualify. France's Paul Pogba, N'Golo Kante and Christopher Nkunku will miss the tournament due to injuries. Other absentees include Zlatan Ibrahimovic, Diogo Jota and Sadio Mane.

386.title: This one-sided moral lesson is hypocrisy: FIFA chief on criticism of Qatar World Cup
386.article_body: FIFA chief Gianni Infantino has hit back at Western critics of the World Cup 2022 in Qatar, due to begin tomorrow, saying, "I have difficulties understanding the criticism." Infantino said, "This one-sided moral lesson is just hypocrisy. I wonder why no one recognises the progress made here since 2016." There have been concerns about Qatari policies towards the LGBTQI community.

387.title: It's an opportunity to get our religion globally out there: Kriti on Adipurush
387.article_body: Kriti Sanon has said it is important for the makers of 'Adipurush' to take their time in making it perfect as it needs to be put out in the right way. The actress, who's playing Sita in the film, added, "We all want to give it the best shot because this is...opportunity to get our history...our religion globally out there."

388.title: India played essential role in negotiating G20 declaration: US
388.article_body: White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre on Saturday said India played an essential role in negotiating the G-20 Summit declaration. She added that Prime Minister Narendra Modi "made it clear that today's era must not be of war". "Prime Minister Modi's relationship was critical to this outcome, and we look forward to supporting India's G20 presidency next year," Jean-Pierre said.

389.title: Navy man's 8-month pregnant wife mowed down by military bus in Chennai
389.article_body: A military bus mowed down an eight-month pregnant woman, who was wife of a Navy man, in Chennai on Friday night. The two of them were returning from Marina Beach when the accident took place. Reports suggest that the bus accidentally ran over her after the victim's husband lost control of his motorcycle and the couple fell on the road.

390.title: Manika creates history, becomes first Indian woman TT player to win a medal at Asian Cup
390.article_body: Manika Batra on Saturday created history by becoming the first-ever Indian woman table tennis player to win a medal at Asian Cup. The 27-year-old defeated world number six and three-time Asian champion Hina Hayata of Japan 4-2 in the bronze medal match. Manika won the match with a scoreline of 11-6, 6-11, 11-7, 12-10, 4-11, 11-2.

391.title: 274 arms licences suspended in Patiala after Punjab govt's order
391.article_body: Patiala district administration has suspended 274 arms licences after Punjab government ordered a review of arms licences within the next three months and banned public display of firearms and songs allegedly promoting gun culture. Deputy Commissioner Sakshi Sawhney said the action was taken for possessing more than two weapons per licence. Show-cause notices have also been served to the owners.

392.title: Delhi-Meerut rapid metro trials to start in December in Ghaziabad
392.article_body: The trial run on the 17-kilometre-long priority stretch of the Delhi-Meerut rapid metro will start in December in Ghaziabad. It is expected to get operationalised by March next year. The priority stretch will run from Sahibabad to Duhai through Guldhar. It is a part of the 82.15 km line that will connect Delhi, Ghaziabad and Meerut.

393.title: India could become net exporter of green energy by 2050: Gautam Adani
393.article_body: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani said the combination of solar and green power, along with green hydrogen would open up "great" opportunities for the future. "By 2050, there is potential for India to become a net exporter of green energy," Adani said. He also reiterated that India would become the third-largest economy "well before" 2030 and the second-largest by 2050.

394.title: Kasturba college students fell ill due to stench from garbage: Hyd Police
394.article_body: Hyderabad Police said around 50 students of Secunderabad's Kasturba Gandhi Junior College for Women fell ill on Friday due to a foul smell emanating from garbage. DCP Chandana Deepti said garbage was being lifted from a nearby spot when students complained of breathlessness and vomiting sensation. Earlier, it was reported that students fell ill after gas leak in science laboratory.

395.title: Indian paddler Manika Batra loses in semis of Asian Cup
395.article_body: Table tennis player Manika Batra, who became the first Indian woman to reach the semi-final of Asian Cup, lost to world number five Mima Ito of Japan 8-11, 11-7, 7-11, 6-11, 11-8, 7-11 in Bangkok on Saturday. With this, the Indian campaign ended at the tournament. Earlier, Sharath Kamal and Sathiyan Gnanasekaran lost in the first round of men's singles.

396.title: Air India will increase its market share to around 30% on all routes: CEO
396.article_body: Air India CEO Campbell Wilson announced the company will increase its market share to around 30% on domestic as well as international routes. He added Air India will be introducing premium economy class in some of its long haul international flights next month. The airline has finalised leases for 30 additional aircraft being delivered over next 12 months, Wilson stated.

397.title: Class 9 student brings toy air gun to Punjab school, causes panic
397.article_body: A Class 9 student was found carrying a toy air gun in his bag in a school in Punjab's Dera Bassi that led to panic. The students who saw the gun believed it to be real and informed the teacher, following which the school principal called the police. The police reached the school and seized the toy gun.

398.title: Camera on-board India's 1st private rocket captures its liftoff, video released
398.article_body: Hyderabad-based startup Skyroot Aerospace has released a video of the liftoff of their Vikram-S rocket that was launched from ISRO's Sriharikota launch pad on November 18 (Friday). The video captured by the camera onboard the rocket shows a view of the Earth as the rocket takes off. The rocket's launch was hailed as a 'new milestone' for independent India.

399.title: It's humbling: Zepto Founder on making it to Hurun India Rich List
399.article_body:
When asked about featuring as the youngest entrants to the Hurun India Rich List 2022, grocery delivery startup Zepto Founders Kaivalya Vohra and Aadit Palicha said it was humbling.
"It's humbling, but honestly, it's not something we end up thinking about every day, because there's always a bunch of stuff going on with the business," Kaivalya said at TechSparks 2022.

400.title: 39-year-old RPF constable dies after being hit by train in Mumbai
400.article_body: A 39-year-old Railway Protection Force (RPF) constable died in a train accident near Borivali Railway Station in Mumbai on Friday. The incident happened when the deceased, Bharat Kumar Prajapati, was patrolling with his colleague before a local train coming from Churchgate hit him from behind, officials said. Notably, Prajapati was a native of Gujarat's Palanpur.

401.title: PM Modi given similar immunity in 2014: US on immunity to Saudi Crown Prince
401.article_body: Speaking about immunity from prosecution afforded to Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed Bin Salman over journalist Jamal Khashoggi's killing, US said such immunity has been applied to several heads of state. "Some examples: President Aristide in Haiti in 1993...PM Modi in India in 2014," spokesperson Vedant Patel said. US had placed PM Modi on visa ban in 2005 over Godhra riots.
